title: Great Customer Service
name: Felicia B.
pros: Pros: With nothing to compare it to, not sure I can give a fair evaluation on software.
cons:
Cons: Redundancies. Too many steps. At this point, with the number of events I have created, it should take less than 5 minutes to set up.

Loading images and getting them to the right size, resolution and added steps to update everytime you make change.

Recommendation would be to allow companies to set up a template and only have to fill in changes to the actual event OR fix Cloning. Whenever I use the Cloning feature, there is always issues that don't make sense.
overall:
Overall: We are a smaller venue and on-line ticket sales are primarily a convenience for customers within the local area. In my opinion, the overall function and ease of use, could be more streamlined to reduce some of the reduncancy when creating an event. I would consider myself above average on a technical level, but there seems to be tedious issues, requiring me to ask for assistance whenever I am creating an event. Having said that, the support we receive from Gary Bradshaw and his quick response at resolving any problems, is excellent. We have not tried other ticketing agencies because of the level of customer service we receive.

To be fair, I have never used another ticketing agent, so I have nothing to compare it to. The reason for 3 Star on Ease of Use is because, while not complicated, it can be tedious and more time consuming than I believe it should.

Having been in business for a long time, even if a particular product or service is slightly higher in cost or slightly lower in quality, it is well worth it when customer service is above reproach.

title: Andrew Peterson presents Behold The Lamb Of God
name: Lisa S.
usage: Used the software for: Less than 6 months
pros: Pros: Very user-friendly - Very detailed - Lots of helpful reports including the profit and loss statement!
cons: Cons: Just the one glitch we had with 8-10 tickets having only the first name on attendees ticket and 2 first names on our attendee list instead of first and last name. For example, instead of Keri Johnson, it had Keri Keri.
overall:
Overall: My overall experience with Attendstar was very positive! Customer service was outstanding! They're very helpful in answering questions, adding tickets, verifying ticket refunds, etc... They were awesome from start to finish!

The afternoon of the concert, I printed out our list of attendees to give to those checking in our guests at the front door. The only glitch we had, there were 8-10 ticket holders that when they presented their tickets, it only had their first name. So we asked for their last name, thinking it was probably just a printing area, but the last name was still not on the attendee list. What we soon figured out was with these 8-10 tickets, was their first name was on the attendee list as both their first and last names. For example, Ticket holder #125, order ID 1419943, was listed on the attendee list as Keri Keri. This was not a huge detriment of anything but I just wanted to let you know so you could look into it from your end. We would definitely use Attendstar again!!! Thanks, Attendstar!!!

cons: Cons: There isn't much not to like. I suppose it'd be nice to be able to copy events or tickets a bit easier, but that's a minor issue.
overall: Overall: We've used AttendStar for multiple events. The software/web UI is easy to navigate and it doesn't take long to master. The feature set continues to improve, and it's clear that the company is continually looking for ways to enhance their product. From my perspective, though, the biggest selling point for AttendStar is how they service their product and value their customers. They are responsive, friendly, thoughtful and you feel like you've got an ally in them -- even though they are filling a particular need, it's clear they want the entire event to be successful. We highly recommend them and mention them to other entertainers and event planners!

title: SAP's platform for the future
name: Verified Reviewer
pros:
Pros: Started using HANA 5 years ago with v1 SPS5 back when it was just released for SAP BW. Back then it was "only" an in-memory DB. With each new SPS release, HANA became better with more DB features integrated. Fast forward to today, it is a full-fledged database platform with enterprise features that rival (and in some cases) even bests Oracle, MSSQL, DB2, et al. For customers who intend to use SAP for the foreseeable future, you would no doubt have HANA already as part of your existing if not future SAP roadmap, given that support for the traditional DBs is until 2025.

SAP HANA, which is re-written from the ground up to fully take advantage of today's modern hardware, supports multi-threaded CPU architecture, use of terabytes of memory to run its in-memory database capabilities, columnar & row based database with full-fledged compression, full support of PL-SQL and many other application components.

From a hardware perspective it is a 2-horse race with the commodity Intel x86 platforms becoming more powerful with each CPU iteration and better CPU core-to-memory ratio support, and IBM with their Power-based CPU architecture. As hardware prices continue to fall and become more powerful, it is only a matter of time before HANA hardware becomes truly commoditised.
cons: Cons: Today SAP HANA is not only a competent database platform, but also is a very robust applications platform. As HANA continues to grow its feature set naturally there are more bugs as a result of a multitude of features. Development of SAP HANA is also diversified across multiple locations around the globe (Walldorf, India, etc.). SAP must do a better job in responding quicker to customers with issues.
overall: Overall: Must-use for all SAP customers, given that it is critical to SAP's success as an enterprise software company.

title: All in one & easy
name: Leah P.
comments: Comments: For an all in one suite ERP, this is the best. Although some areas are not quite as robust as some would like, SAP really nailed it with this one. They address a huge span of customers with the one product, which is completely customizable if you want to spend the money. However, most of the time, companies find that they can walk with the product, no customizations for the first 6mos. Then they get a good feel for what they want to change.
pros: Pros: SAP took all of the knowledge gained with ECC, B1, etc. & published it into this cloud solution. You buy the license, and you have access to all modules. It is not a new charge to add in Project Management for example. You just turn it on. Online help documents are outstanding, and you can literally learn the entire software functionality by following them. With it being a cloud solution, you get auto updates every 3mo, which is nice. It updates some of the default government fees, for all of the countries you have in your system. Expense reporting for example. There is very little administration needed to let the software flow once you turn it on. And the best part is that you just need internet to access the software.
cons: Cons: It is for mid-size businesses. So for larger organizations, the licensing can get pricey. There is a limited amount of knowledge in the field on the product, so it can take some time to get answers for some topics from the partners, or to find info online.

title: Everything is done for you!
name: Leah P.
usage: Used the software for: Less than 6 months
comments: Comments: I have been working with this product for almost 2 years now. Most of my knowledge is self-taught from the online documents. This system is as robust as you wish it to be. The thinking has been done. Language packs, which apply in all modules, Country-specific financial rules that are updated constantly (IRS Guidelines for Expense Reporting for example), auto calculations, multi-currency use within one transaction. A counter part in Germany can operate in German, while all of mine can be in English when I am troubleshooting their issues, I think is outstanding. SAP is constantly updating, they have a great team backing the product, it is very personable user experience in my opinion. We use it for Order to Cash. We use the Supply Chain set up, full Financials. Production of Materials, Purchasing, Customer Service, just not POS. Although it has the ability, our business does not operate that way.
pros: Pros: The process is built in, it is native to the operation of the system. SAP's been in the business long enough to be able to take all of the success from Enterprise ERP applications that they have built, and merge this into an online application. The product is very versatile for what I would think many styles of business. I personally enjoy the idea of not having to program the system to react a specific way, I work through the process in a test, using the online documentation, some time with an SAP Partner (Consulting Company), but the hours spent there are little. We also have the additional SDK, so we can write some personalization to the product if we wish to. The SAP Support tools are wonderful, there is probably too many resources to reach out to.
cons: Cons: Not available in HTML in the production environments yet. Some users have been testing out the HTML in the test tenants. It is completely different layout. We would love to be able to drag & drop attachments instead of having to browse to them.
recommendations to other buyers: Recommendations to other buyers: I personally would recommend this product to anyone looking to upgrade or start out with an ERP / MRP. This tool is very robust, you can bring on one module at a time, and all different implementation partners know what they are doing, as SAP validates their abilities first. This is a very well-thought out product.

title: SAP HANA provides an in memory database for fast data access and processing
name: Richard C.
pros: Pros: I like hat HANA is in-memory computing technology that provides an in memory database for fast data access and processing to users. Properties like faster data fetching, quick execution times, speedy access to external Apps make it a very useful technology. The business problems being solved with the product are as the data volume grows, the conventional database based reports and processes tend to slow down. This at times negatively affects the year on year trend analysis and processes requiring multiple data fetch. HANA, being in memory database virtually eliminates these issues. The data fetch is almost instantaneous and the processes run much faster.
cons: Cons: I see nothing negative about the technology in itself. The roll out of this platform could have been done in a better way. The cloud integration of SAP has been slow as well. These I thing that can be looked into
overall: Overall: I what find is that since SAP is firmly sticking with in memory computing and making all of their processes compatible with in-memory computing. This eventually forces customers to migrate to HANA but the user experience in HANA is much better compared to the alternate in my opinion. This is recommended for any SAP customer with large volumes of data that needs processing, reporting and analysis. I would recommend with training

cons: Cons: A better price is desirable.

Performance issues of ECC 6.0, challenges in adapting new technologies and sap innovations, moving to user-friendly interfaces and business analytics propelled us to adopt S4HANA. The vision from management, especially our director, to move the organization processes to next level by digitalization of business processes. We needed a solid technology and platform, on which we can digitalise and scale. Adoption of FIORI solutions for better user experience with workflow and to build analytics is a major reason for moving to S4HANA.

Performance issues of SAP ECC 6.0, challenges in adapting new technologies and sap innovations, moving to user-friendly interfaces and business analytics propelled us to adopt S4HANA. recommendations to other buyers: Recommendations to other buyers: Highly Recommended

title: ANALYTICS AND ERPS - WHAT BUSINESSES NEEDED
name: Verified Reviewer
pros:
Pros: 1. The data processing speeds are greatly improved on the HANA platform. This is due to the in-memory technology incorporated into the system.

2. Very easy to set up and integration with SAP is almost flawless. This is especially true with cloud.

3. The user interface is not only eye catching, it also incorporates analytics which enable the users to create interactive dashboards, graphs and widgets.

4. Since it is a database in itself, which supports data to be stored in columns (as opposed to the previously used MS SQL, which stores in rows), it allows for faster data processing, analytics and more efficient storage of data.

5. It allows a company to monitor key KPIs.

6. In terms of security, it is very efficient. It relies on encryption, patching and best practices when it comes to security. It is also linux-based which provides a very secure platform
cons:
Cons: 1. The hardware and software specifications required to run HANA may be unavailable to some businesses hence if a company wants to use it, the would have to acquire them.

2. The dashboards and some of the analytical features are unavailable on mobile.

3. While customizing and writing stored procedures, one must be very careful as the application is linux-based hence it is case sensitive.
overall: Overall: It is very reliable, fast and efficient. It has enabled many companies to streamline processes and access a myriad of information related to their companies in real time

title: A step into the future.
name: Verified Reviewer
pros: Pros: SAP HANA, or Netweaver over HANA DB (HDB) is a step into the future. Before this concept of in-memory computing and memory storage (without reading the disk all the time), some reports took very long to load. Now you can get access to a larger piece of data in seconds. HANA also brings BW to another level of real time reporting, even detailed information can be shown in no time, its very fast. The way we build views by using the HANA Modeler is very simple but yet powerful, you can do a lot with little knowledge and much more with some expertise.
cons: Cons: The tools used to work with HANA are both the HANA Studio or Eclipse with SAP HANA plugins. In my opinion, it could be better than it is; with more components, less bugs (you have to restart the environment every once in a while) and a better explanation about how the aggregation you see has been formed (Simpler than PlanViz).
overall: Overall: With SAP HANA, my skills in view calculations have increased, I have another point of view about how to create one type of report or another. It is also very productive and very fast response. In addition with other tools like SAP Lumira, Qlik View / Sense and Tableau you can get a nice result, it leverages BI to another level and makes your experience even better.

I consider the ERP's weakness in advanced manufacturing functions, in the management of mass purchases and in the capacity of large batches of information.

There is a lot of maneuverability within SAP that is unmatched elsewhere, which is largely due to the fact that modules are built in-house. The support team for SAP is immense, and having worked with two pharmaceutical giants, the one that used SAP had more power to implement new functions.
cons: Cons: The turnaround time on updates/upgrades is awful, there's just no other way to put it. You could design a new software from the ground up between updates.
overall: Overall: The program allowed me to easily manipulate orders for clients, whether large or small. There's always an ease of understanding of how the system works, although there is a significant training investment required before it becomes user-friendly.

title: International Purchases
name: Tadeo W.
pros: Pros: The ease that I have to put order, charge prices, search purchase history, review supplier data, among others
cons: Cons: The difficult thing that it is done to the suppliers to be able to fill the Request of offer and be able to associate it with its number of parts.
overall: Overall: Is a system with which I work every day bought all kinds of spare parts and equipment for the different polar lienas

title: Powerful in-memory database for Transactional and Analytical Processing
name: Caroline I.
pros: Pros: I have interacted with with SAP HANA for one year now. Sap HANA is a powerful in-memory database by SAP that allows both transactions and analytics to run on it. Sap HANA allows for fast processing of large volumes of data.
cons: Cons: SAP HANA is generally costly and more complex as compared to other database solutions for SAP in the market. I think the benefits offered by the database are totally worth every coin you spend on the database.
overall: Overall: SAP HANA is powerful. With this rapidly changing business environment, you need a database that can offer powerful analytic capability to help you make speedy and informed decisions for your business and stay ahead of the competition.

title: I've been a SAP user for 10 years

But this HANA database it's been a new great solution for it.
cons: Cons: Sadly, implementing sap hana can become very expensive for the customer, starting on a appliance or cloud system with high requeriments, like 500GB ram and few terabytes of disk, that would be the main issue, so not many customer can implement it.
overall: Overall: A lot of experience. i've liked it, i think is the future of sap software, a good speed on database side can improve a lot any system, i even did the certificaction for sap hana 12, a good knowledge of it can make be grow profesionally.

It is as well integrated with the various IT tool we use trhoughout the company so that financial data converge all into one place from the various tools. Easier to get the global view of trhe operations.
cons: Cons: Can take time to learn. Graphics a bit outdated as with most SAP ERP software.

name: Verified Reviewer
pros: Pros: The amount of possibilities of implementations using SAP Hana Cloud Platform is enormous. I consider it as a must-have for enabling the steady growth of a company.
cons: Cons: The SAP prices are high - not only in terms of using the system, but mostly in terms of any developments - Business Process Architects are highly demanded on market which makes it pricey to develop new functions (IT as well), but the highest price is the consultants, especially from SAP. This all sums up to a very high cost for a great software.

title: Solution for major corporations
name: Cynthia L.
pros: Pros: It's fast and is a necessary enhancement for all companies that utilize any SAP module. When competing against Amazon and Microsoft, SAP HANA puts up a competitive fight and SAP S/4 HANA Cloud is a necessary addition to the whole package.
cons: Cons: Expensive. Very very expensive to roll out SAP HANA and S/4 HANA Cloud across entire company.

title: Powerful tool for decision making
name: Vitor P.
pros: Pros: The tool does not require IT investment to be implemented.
cons: Cons: The tool is not accessible if you are not familiar with SAP products.
overall: Overall: A powerful tool for decision making and business insights.

title: Used this in a previous job for processing orders. Found it acceptable, but not amazing.
name: Rebecca B.
pros:
Pros: - Once someone explains the basics of it to you, it's reasonably easy to use.

- The documentation for this software is very good and allows you to find out how to do what you need to do quite quickly. Furthermore, if you encounter issues the customer service is very good and fast.
cons: Cons: - The user interface feels like it's stuck in the 1990s. I understand that it's more about functionality than appearance, but starting at it for a whole workday can be quite a gloomy experience. It doesn't feel like a nice 'atmosphere' to work in, and I feel some aesthetic improvements would vastly improve user experience.
overall: Overall: Allowed me to do my job smoothly and with little hassle.

title: Efficient System for CRM and Financial Management
name: Verified Reviewer
pros: Pros: SAP is known for efficient and reliable ERP Systems worldwide and the ByDesign suite is no exception. It's easy to generate reports and manage the work flows once you get to understand how to use it
cons: Cons: The license costs can be stiff, especially for small and medium sized organizations with a few users

title: Not Quite Ready to Win the Championship
name: Verified Reviewer
pros: Pros: The features here are ambitious and with a simple business with few complexities could be nice to leverage.
cons: Cons: The platform and overall user experience is not very intuitive. If you're in a complex business with users of all levels of expertise when it comes to understanding software, expect some growing pains when it comes to the rollout of this platform.
overall: Overall: The overall experience has been extremely painful. Users from a large global company are finding it difficult to adapt to using this software. There are also limitations with 3rd party integrations. The key benefit is if your company is already in the SAP ecosystem, the platform does speak nice to its other enterprise solutions.

title: SAP Business ByDesign: Flexible, adaptable, scalable ERP
name: Curtis C.
pros: Pros: SAP has more than 40 years of best business practices built into the software. Then, to have a cloud-based product that reduces IT infrastructure, and keeps my business information where I need it, when I need it, is truly a win-win for any business.
cons: Cons: If there was one thing I did not like about SAP, it would be their time-to-market. They are consistently 6 months behind. However, I also think this is one of their strengths - which is to not bring a product to market before it is ready. SAP has always done well in this regard.
recommendations to other buyers: Recommendations to other buyers: Do you research. Make sure your processes are in line with supporting an ERP. Ask yourself if your business is ready for ERP. If so, look at SAP. It is not just for big companies. It is for your company.

title: Constantly working to update functionality
name: Dan N.
usage: Used the software for: Less than 6 months
comments: Comments: I have been using SAP ByD for 2+ years now. We have the system in use for 3 separate companies, worldwide. We use the Fixed Assets module, Travel and Expenses, Cost Accounting, Manufacturing, Sales. It handles everything quite well.
pros: Pros: The thinking is done for us. Other software would require some background programming, this one has it all updated to the current government agency settings.
cons: Cons: The freezing on screens, when I try to run specific reports.
recommendations to other buyers: Recommendations to other buyers: Worth the investment streamlined everything for us.

title: Junk By Design
name: Christopher P.
comments: Comments: I have used and configured many ERP systems and with out a doubt this is the worst system money could buy. Do yourself a favor and look elsewhere.
pros: Pros: The only pro would be it is cloud based. Beyond that there is no reason to use this in your business unless you would like to lose customers and employee's
cons: Cons: Slow performance, terrible interface, not intuitive, not configurable. Crashes constantly. Poor online support, poor training guides. Ten steps to do one task. The service, HR , Marketing section are worthless. Good luck finding the correct design studio tools Absolute junk.

title: Best of a bad bunch
name: Ryan K.
pros: Pros: Best ERP system out there but still not an ideal product. Great documentation to accompany your purchase of the system. Not very bug-filled given maturity and age of product.
cons: Cons: Clunky application that's not extremely intuitive; support team could be improved in terms of issue resolution time

title: Poor decision in the graphics industry
name: Verified Reviewer
pros: Pros: This software is robust, it helps to have all employee inputs within one program for a project
cons: Cons: This software is trying to do much at once, SAP was sold as a solution to the last two companies I worked for in the creative industry but in each case the SAP software has caused more harm than help. The software is good for invoicing but there are too many bugs or loop holes in the program causing records to be untraceable or inefficient. It should not take 20 minutes plus a manual override to a software bug to create a slipping ship.
overall: Overall: I hate it.

title: Using SAP for inputting orders was somehow difficult but as well helpful. It had constant updates.
name: Verified Reviewer
pros: Pros: I like SAP because it allow us to create orders, edit them, cancel them and review status of canceled or out of stock materials.
cons: Cons: Some processes in SAP can be confusing due to the various tabs and options you have within. Also it can be very slow depending on how large the order is.

title: SAP HANA Consulting Project
name: Saran E.
comments: Comments: I have implemented this tool across different organizations and trained users in using HANA's warehousing and integration capabilities.

title: Help to software buyers
name: Tin Nilar T.
pros: Pros: Can input the Financial data such as Account Receiable , Account Payable , Budget v.s Actual result , daily revenue , Purchase Order etc.
cons: Cons: This software user account for employee is expensive. So , only 15 personnel can access SAP user account in 35 personnel in our department.
overall: Overall: Sometimes, we can not know exactly the person who make input data wrongly due to one SAP account for 3 or 4 personnel.

title: ITS GOOD ACCOUNTING SOFTWARE
name: TAHA S.
pros: Pros: SAP IS A VERY USEFUL AND RELIABLE ACCOUNTING SOFTWARE WHCIH IS HIGHLY RECOMANDABLE FOR ALL BIG FIRMS.
cons: Cons: AS I SAID ITS GOOD SOFTWARE BUT THE ONLY DRAW BACK WHAT I FOUND WAS THAT ITS VERY MUCH PROTECTED AND ITS NOT THAT USER FRIENDLY LIKE TALLY

title: Review of SAP cloud ERP from a User
name: Freddy Rainier T.
usage: Review is based on a free trial
pros:
Pros:

The large number of different modules that this software has in a manufacturing environment.
cons:
Cons:

the large number of steps that have to be done to generate key reports of the processes.

title: This ERP is excellent and helps with planning & forecasting.
name: Corey S.
pros: Pros: Excellent software to use in coordinating orders & inventory. It's nice to be able to track finances and helps with planning & forecasting. Being able to use the program for other departments. I like that it can be configured for daily tasks that is very efficient. It is very time saving and can help reduce costs.
cons: Cons: Customization is a requirement to make shortcuts. It would be nice to have more tools from third party sites as you only have the basics. Having to pay for monthly maintenance and upkeep can damper the costs.
overall: Overall: Easy to use. Helps with forecasting.

title: It helps you a lot to have control over the numbers.
name: Rosa Sabrina S.
usage: Used the software for: Less than 6 months
pros: Pros: What I like if you can run simulations about situations such as fiscal year. Is really handy for creating a budget in any area.
cons: Cons: Depend of the size of your work, it takes time to load and sometimes that could be really frustrating.
overall: Overall: Is actually I really new system in my work and actually the people have adapted really good because of the user friendly interface.

title: Tool used in the industrial field
name: Jhon Jairo V.
usage: Used the software for: Less than 6 months
pros: Pros: Functional tool for the organization of work orders, industrial logistics, its different interdisciplinary modules make it a highly requested tool
cons: Cons: the tool does not have free information for its learning, it is linked to second persons for its learning and its high cost makes it a difficult tool to reach for small and medium enterprises

title: Good system - hard to use
name: gwen M.
comments: Comments: good system if you know how to use it
pros: Pros: Good functionality logical system good documentation for support good best practice standard processes
cons: Cons: difficult to use lack of expertise on how to use this system in the market rigid - difficult to do customization

title: Not very user friendly
name: Christian B.
pros:
Pros: SAP offers powerful tools which offer lots of customization.

Reliable and stable system that supports almost every one of our business processes.
cons:
Cons: I don't know why SAP is so famous for it's ERP sytem. It sute got better, but it still has such a complicated user Interface. Many processes and workflows could be designed much better.

You have to put so much customization that costs increase dramatically.

title: It is a great software to use. Nice Experience
name: Prabhjyot S.
usage: Used the software for: Less than 6 months
pros: Pros: I have found this product user friendly to use. I have gone through the training resources and when I hit the floor, their customer support set me on the right track. It really seems that the reporting possibilities are only limited by my imagination. As an added benefit, the price prospective.
cons: Cons: I look forward to have a reporting part should be in more detailed version. I need this reporting functionality in order to prepare for my team. I believe it should be in their next release.
overall: Overall: I believe overall this is the best software to use and understand and cost effective in terms of their ideas. Expect better customer support experience and new items added in their next release.

title: Changing over to SAP HANA
name: Christanne C.
usage: Used the software for: Less than 6 months
pros: Pros: It's relatively the same as the old SAP version that we used, but it makes everything easier. It seems to make more sense.
cons: Cons: It was not pleasant having to change systems whatsoever, but it wasn't too bad. Upgrading to HANA was well worth it

title: Sap Hana
name: Siddharth ..
pros: Pros: Sap Hana is making a change to analytics industry by its innovative concepts and support to cloud platforming .
cons: Cons: its GUI can be improved a bit so that it can be more user friendly.
overall: Overall: Overall its the best tool to use for analytics

title: SAP Hana Database
name: Verified Reviewer
pros: Pros: The speed of report generation and the ability to perform analytics has tremendously imporved with the usage of HANA database
cons: Cons: Initially it is difficult to understand and get a hands on on the system
overall: Overall: Brilliant

title: SAP ByDesign
name: Bo Z.
usage: Used the software for: Less than 6 months
comments: Comments: It's a one of the best ERP solution from SAP for small to midsized companies. It's cloud based ERP which reduces the implementation cost, and you can customize the way you like it, as well as flexible integration with other products. The UI is very user friendly too.
cons: Cons: Some times it is very slow

title: Excellent! amazing how in one system you can integrate all company's functions
name: Marianna P.
pros:
Pros: You can have visibility in all functions and transactions

Whatever the department is, you can extract information on various functions including finance, inventory management, purchase, manufacturing, sales on the finger tips.
cons: Cons: The lack of flexibility it has creates a significant drwaback, though most of times business tasks need to be flexible and need to be served from an ERP in each and every time

title: Complicated at first but easy as you use
name: Sai Y.
comments: Comments: SAP ERP was a very complex system when I started to use it first. As I used it and learnt more about how the system works and different architectural details, it seemed more easy to use. Overall, we use it to basically create a sales order, delivery or purchase order to test our process in TMS system. ERP itself provides a lot of challenges of setting up an organization and integrating with another system is a challenge by itself. Once you set up the basic structure and integration starts working, its a smooth and easy system to use.

title: Newbee
name: Eileen K.
usage: Used the software for: Less than 6 months
pros: Pros: I'm a new bee at SAP Business it is useful for pulling reports and I like the graphs and comparative reports
cons: Cons: Does not seem user friendly. Looks like it's very old

title: SAP Exepriences - Multiple Versions Multiple Environments
name: Don M.
comments: Comments: SAP Financials has become more streamlined, intuitive and less complex to use with end users in accounting departments over the years. It requires training and skills, and Best Practices with Standard SAP is still the way to go, non customized. The reality is, business do customize, create complexity, to service there business, then require technical skills and functional skills to support there respective environments. ECC6 has come along ways from 2.0.......during my career.

title: Time consuming
name: Verified Reviewer
pros: Pros: Robust program, we use at enterprise level.
cons: Cons: Not intuitive user interface, unless you are a power user it is difficult to figure out how to do what you want to do with the software.

title: SAP ERP FICO; SAP BI (BW/BEx; BOBJ BI/EIM); SAP EPM (BPC)
name: Saran E.
comments: Comments: One of the four mega-vendors, SAP has solution offerings for nearly every industry and business process area. With their continued innovation for the cloud era, your organization may potentially benefit. Don't use SAP if you are not willing to shell out for the 3rd party applications and integrations that improve the success of meeting your organization's business technology needs - just the SAP portfolio alone won't cut it in most cases.

title: Excellent user interface
name: Brandon V.
pros: Pros: The user interface looks good..coupled with its ease of use makes it a no brainer- I'd recommend to anyone!

title: Solid product
name: Franz K.
pros: Pros: Business By Design is a solid SAP Cloud ERP product. It is easy to set up and more suitable for smaller and medium-sized companies.
cons: Cons: At medium-sized companies, you will have many problems getting all the processes right. The expansion options are not designed for very large individualization.

title: Wonderful new technology
name: Lorena M.
usage: Used the software for: Less than 6 months
comments: Comments: Consolidated disparate systems and gave me real time reporting, there was some doubt this could be accomplished, but they over delivered on their promises.

title: Great platform for professional services
name: Rod T.
usage: Used the software for: Less than 6 months
comments: Comments: Having reviews the cloud ERP landscape I found that SAP Business ByDesign is the most competitive platform for manufacturing

title: Still the best
name: Alex F.
pros: Pros: They thought of everything
cons: Cons: Implementation cost
overall: Overall: Been working with this since 1997. It hasn't been cool for a long time but all those companies can't be wrong. No ERP solution comes close. If you're prepared to bend your company to the software, it'll run the show. But you know that already, cos there's nobody left to buy it who doesn't already have it.

title: Not user friendly - too many steps to process transactions
name: Mark U.
pros: Pros: Easy to find employees familiar with the product product knowledge in the workforce. Proven track record of working in large companies
cons: Cons: Too much training involved to use. Need to custimize software to use efficiently. Other softwares are more defined out of the box.

title: Great platform to manage event tickets and attendees
name: Verified Reviewer
pros: Pros: We use SAP Event Ticketing to manage issued tickets to our employees and clients during our marketing events. Attendees are able to rsvp and confirm their extra guests, which assists us to estimate and budget for the number of people to expect
cons: Cons: SAP Event Ticketing has been an effective in helping us manage our events. The costs can however be prohibitive for a small organization
overall: Overall: Great platform to manage event tickets!

title: it is an excellent experience this really help you with your management Enterprise Resource Planning
name: javier r.
pros: Pros: the most i like about this is that you can management all the Enterprise Resource, so that you can get better efficie.
cons: Cons: sometime it can be hard to use you need to do this software easier to use, so that every one can use this efficiently in all enterprise

title: Excellent tool to manage the business
name: Abu H.
comments: Comments: Robi Axiata Ltd. implemented SAP in 2006 with lot of challenges at its initial stages. Later employees started using it and Management were able to see the whole company picture (in terms of financial info) accurately within a click. In 2011 technical version ugradation was done along with a CBI (Continuous Business Improvement) study and lot of new features added.

title: Hard to understand
name: Verified Reviewer
pros: Pros: there is a lot of information about this product online and gives a lot of time to look through the detailed videos, booklets and articles about the product
cons: Cons: A every complicated piece of software and hard to understand. Have to spend a lot of money on training for this software
overall: Overall: This is an amazing piece of software however to get the most out of most SAP products you have to keep buying new stuff

title: Best Integrated ERP Suite
name: Denis G.
comments: Comments: Integration is often misunderstood. Having all the information available in real time immediately after inputting a transaction is key to understanding the current status of the business. This, on the other end, impose serious requirements in making sure the information entered does not includes any errors. The main challenge of integration is communication.

title: Its very useful, especially when planning at an aggregrate level.
name: Catalina C.
comments: Comments: Every day i learnt another feature which made my daily job so much easier. Having all the info in real time from different centers and countries really help. Having the option to audit transactions is great!! It allows you to validate data anytime and assure better output for planning processes. After I started using it, i just cant work without it.

title: Great product, improving user interface
name: Doug S.
comments: Comments: SAP's financial and HCM modules are powerful tools that allow lots of customization. The user interface, however, has often left a lot to be desired. SAP is using Fiori to bridge that gap but it will take quite a bit of time to reach the place of other software companies born in the digital age. Nonetheless, no real substantive complaints!

title: This program helps to find caps that we need names for.
name: Verified Reviewer
pros: Pros: I like that it is pretty easy to use. I like that you can use multiple keywords to find what you are looking for.
cons: Cons: I wish it was updated a bit. If it had updated software maybe it would work a little faster than other programs.

title: Producing payroll for employees, and tracking employee performance.
name: Matthew Bishop B.
comments: Comments: As for pros, I really like the many customization options and the automation. SAP ERP provides real time reports, and they are available immediately. In addition, all the information is able to viewed by any employee at multiple sites. The cons would be the fact that the installation process is quite lengthy and time consuming.

title: SAP SRM Functional Consultant for over 3 year
name: Swapnil C.
comments:
Comments: Pros: New portal of SAP SRM is very user friendly. The deployment is fast. Easy to customize. Many configuration can be done as per the need of the business.Industry based solution.

Cons: When using ERP for the new user its difficult to understand the design.

title: SAP ABAP
name: John K.
comments: Comments: Great software to ensure industry standards, very hard to customize to unique business processes and it is never a one size fits all. However if done correctly this software is invaluable to any organization who is looking to be at the top of their market.

title: Great value
name: Mark J.
comments:
Comments: Found Sap Erp to be of great value ,found it to be of great flexibility and very good use overall .

I would be slightly disappointed with the overall tech support side of things ,very slow in answering a query.

title: Sap ibp map!
name: Shane F.
comments: Comments: It is hard to use or know all the capabilities of our system! We try to have information from one report go to another and it will not share all data. So we need to have all information available to all pages

title: Experience in both Contract Administrator and Purchasing Coordinator modules
name: Andrew D.
comments: Comments: Covers a wide variety of industries, and areas, at times there are too many options, transactions, icons, and ways to do the same thing. It's a good software but at times difficult to use, and not as flexible as other less known ERP solutions.

title: SAP great product, great service
name: Richard F.
comments: Comments: SAP is a fantastic complete software system that integrates all functions of the company. SAP has ease of function and use, capable of handling supply chain, customer service, operation control, sales analysis and financial reporting.

title: Best Enterprise Resource Planning Software
name: Pavi R.
comments:
Comments: SAP brings seamless integration among the various business processes in procurement, manufacturing, sales and financials.

It also has technical capabilities to integrate with external systems like web.

title: Very Powerful Tool
name: Kevin L.
comments: Comments: SAP does some incredible things. It can be overwhelming at times its capabilities, but it is very powerful. We manage everything at our work through SAP and without it, we would literally not function.

title: SAP ERP
name: Channing M.
comments: Comments: SAP is great in helping the accounting department accomplish more tasks accurately with less research. It also keeps track of the last person who used a particular document, which assists with accountability and error reduction.

title: Great software, very professional
name: Verified Reviewer
pros: Pros: They have all the functions we need, and flexible to customize based on our demand. Their consulting team is professional. The training classes are very helpful to users.
cons: Cons: The consulting service is very pricey. They charge users every year. I hope they can offer discounts for loyal customers.

title: Great for Large businesses.
name: Shriya C.
usage: Used the software for: Less than 6 months
pros: Pros: SAP has loads of features and resources that can help a large business. There are so many resources and tutorials that can also help to make the integration more seamless. It is a user-friendly software.
cons: Cons: I think that its interface is very clunky. It took me quite a while to figure things out and get things right with SAP.

title: SAP The processes you run have to be changed. Or this will not give you the results exoected
name: Keith W.
pros: Pros: Quick to enter
overall:
Overall: System changes went from days to a year +

SAP charge too much for support which is only on core code not amended code

Users performance not improved as expected

title: Among the best ERPs
name: Guy M.
comments: Comments: One of the best, no doubt, however I do believe the user interface is outdated and it's not a very easy to use solution. Nonetheless, the functionality it holds is impeccable.

title: SAP S/4HANA Review
name: Verified Reviewer
pros: Pros: SAP S4 HANA is more powerful than the old SAP ERP. The table structure has been modified to make extractions quicker and more efficient.
cons: Cons: As with any SAP software, it takes a time and resources to implement. The return on investment is longer than other softwares.

title: I like SAP but it's pretty hard to figure out how to use.
name: Charlotte Y.
comments: Comments: We use SAP for all of our auditing needs. It's a wealth of function sna dinformation but have to always google the T codes which is pretty annoying. Not intuitive at all.

title: SAP Fast data extractions

comments: Comments: I am able to access and analyze data much faster than with mapics erp. As the primary data analyst at my company it is a huge help to have clean data quickly

title: An Excellent ERP System
name: Greg K.
comments: Comments: SAP ERP is an excellent and all encompassing system. May not be the absolutely easiest to use but is thourgh and all encompassing an gets the best results.

title: SAP ERP Systems
name: Rande W.
comments: Comments: Overall we struggled with initial implementation but once we were more mature the product performed well and has provided great value to our organization

title: SAP ERP - Great software
name: Jayant V.
comments: Comments: Cons - Perception of being too complicated, Lack of Flexibility to Choose .

title: It was a great product 5 yrs back
name: Marty S.
comments: Comments: It was a great product 5 yrs back . But comparing with the velocity psychology shift of organization, need to have a better solution. Believe S4 would be able to bridge the gap.

title: SAP ERP software

comments: Comments: The one piece of software that every company should have.. makes the life of users easy by providing access to all the data under one place

title: I loved it

comments: Comments: It was easy to use, it was user friendly, definitely efficient and time saving. I would recommend this software to anyone.

title: Great in functionality, very bad in design and user experience
name: Hasnain M.
comments: Comments: I have been in several companies that used SAP ERP and have even consulted a lot. SAP is a lot like building blocks, it can be customized to whatever companies want although with a lot of pain so functionality wise I think it is enterprise standard, but 0 points for user experience. Users these days in the consumer world are used to applications that are easy to use, friendly to operate, lets just say SAP has a long road ahead to get the application to that level

title: Old version but ercellent
name: Greg K.
comments: Comments: Works great but converting due to corporate buyout. Have no complaints and sorry to have to change rather then upgrade.

title: A bit clunky but gets the job done

cons: Cons: A bit clunky at times but not the end of the world

title: Loads of features, dated interface
name: Olivier N.
comments: Comments: Sap is the gold standard in ERP software but it really shows its age. The menus are cumbersome to navigate.

title: Amazing product
name: puneet s.
comments: Comments: It incorporates all key business functions of my organization. Implementation is bit tricker, but once we start using it, it is amazing .

title: Great functionality

comments: Comments: I don't find SAP the most user friendly system, but it certainly does everything we need it to and then some.

title: It's Great!

comments: Comments: This has been fabulous, easy to use and been a great overall experience! I would highly reccommmend!

title: Excellent product, easy to use, helpful customer service

comments: Comments: Excellent product, easy to use, had some configuration issues for customization, but customer service helped resolve those with ease.

Comments: Highly customizable system which makes the end user experience more difficult sometimes.

Extremely powerful tool if used properly.

title: multi-layer with multifunctionality works well with other output programs

comments: Comments: like many systems there's a lot of restrictions with BOM management. overall it works great with a multi billion dollar company.

title: Makes things simple

comments: Comments: We use these systems in our purchasing department. It's an amazing software that has been developed well! Worth the investment.

comments:
Comments: The integration of SAP with the web, bi, bw is excellent.

I woul recommend SAP to every industry.

title: Improving constantly

title: Powerful
name: Barb K.
comments: Comments: Business processes must be thoroughly analyzed prior to implementation to optimize ROI.

title: Best out there

title: Great experience

comments:
Comments: easy to use and bug free.

Many online tutorials available to learn.

title: Very good ERP software for big organisations
name: Anjana V.
usage: Used the software for: Less than 6 months
pros: Pros: It has all the features and functions required for the smooth running of a business
cons: Cons: It is not that user friendly and requires training to use the software
overall: Overall: Recommended for complex and big organisations

title: Outdated but necessary
name: Cynthia L.
comments: Comments: Not user friendly, but an extremely powerful tool that when utilized properly and to it's fullest extent, can lead to cost savings and more effective analysis. There's so many different modules that span across different business core functions, but a larger data volume could mean slower queries. Also too much personalization can do more harm than good.

title: Good user friendly tool

title: SAP ERP
name: Mayuri c.

name: gene v.
comments: Comments: assumes your company is logical and intelligent

title: Life changer for all the companies

comments: Comments: almost everything is automated and integrated

title: I love it!
name: Kevin C.
comments: Comments: Very Easy to use. Configure and deploy.

title: Great Product
name: Deb R.
comments: Comments: You don't have build your bricks .

title: Good functions and ease of use
name: Verified Reviewer
pros:
Pros: the system is used to maintain the POs and the the business orders from various departments and products for various clients. The pros: are that it is

-easy to use

-maintaining optimal for new users

-organized formatting

-easy to interface
cons:
Cons: There are not problematic cons that can identified

but to name a few there is

title: SAP HANA

title: Easy
name: Juan Camilo R.
position: L_der de Planeaci_n Financiera y Tesorer_a
usage: Used the software for: Less than 6 months

title: COULD NOT BE HAPPIER!!!
name: Lindsay M.
pros:
Pros: -AMAZING customer service. Probably the best customer service i've ever dealt with ever. Louis was available via email and phone and wrote back to emails immediately. I never felt stressed waiting for a call back from him b/c he was so prompt in getting back to me. I really wish all companies had someone as attentive and reliable as he was with ticketpeak.

-The site is very easy to maneuver through. At first i wasn't sure what to click and where to go but after playing around a little bit, it was mostly self explanatory and most people would have no problem using it.

-EXTREMELY quick in getting our site up and running. It was less than 24 hours from the time i sent Louis our seating chart and we started selling tickets.

-LOVE that you can add a jpeg logo to personalize tickets.

-It's GREAT that you can add messages on the ticket regarding the show.

-the reports the site provides are SOOOO informative and helpful afterwards.

-We received a ton of compliments.
cons: Cons: I can honestly say that i cannot think of any cons of this site or the people that i dealt with. It really is a fabulous site and program and I have and will continue to recommend it to people who could benefit from it.
overall: Overall: We had decided this year to switch to online assigned seat ticketing so that it would be less work for us during the school day and less lines at the door due to the fact we were always general admission. We went back and forth on whether or not we wanted to do it and i look back now and i'm mad at the time we wasted making a decision because it was THE BEST DECISION we could have made. It saved us SOOO much time and aggravation and kept our lobby so much more pleasant. In the past people waited an hour or more on line so that they got a good seat. Now, people came 15-30 minutes before show time, could walk around the lobby and then go in to their assigned seats. We noticed we also sold a lot of merchandise in our lobby this year because people did not need to stand in line, which was an extra added bonus! DO NOT WASTE TIME, EMAIL TICKETPEAK TODAY!!! You will NOT be dissapointed!!! Thank you Louis for all your help!!!

cons: Cons: The reports are pretty clunky and a bit confusing to download. It would be nice to archive old events such that they no longer show up on the reports option. Marking dozens of boxes to sort to a specific event is pretty annoying.

title: This has been a great solution for our theatre group. It has aided in cash flow, important for us.
name: Wendy L.
pros: Pros: Training was easy, it's very intuitive. Our customers have asked for online technology for a long time and they are happy too with the ease of use of the software.
cons: Cons: I would like to be able to make distinct groupings for our classes, I loaded Fall, Spring, March Breaks and they are one long list, it would be easier to see what you are looking for if there could be breaks in the listings. I'd love a bigger logo for our group too.
overall: Overall: Our cash flow was better. We did paper registration and cheques/cash the first day of class. Now we have a continuous online registration. We are still converting people to online after all the years of being paper based. It's easy to print registration lists to know who's coming and how much room we have in the class. Online ticket sales are great, we know when our small studio is sold out.

title: Great Customer Support!
name: Eric S.
comments: Comments: the folks at Ticketpeak are extremely responsive and easy to work with. The service itself is very easy to use, both for us and for those getting seats.
pros: Pros: Training was easy, it's very intuitive. Our customers have asked for online technology for a long time and they are happy too with the ease of use of the software.
cons: Cons: I would like to be able to make distinct groupings for our classes, I loaded Fall, Spring, March Breaks and they are one long list, it would be easier to see what you are looking for if there could be breaks in the listings. I'd love a bigger logo for our group too.
overall: Overall: Our cash flow was better. We did paper registration and cheques/cash the first day of class. Now we have a continuous online registration. We are still converting people to online after all the years of being paper based. It's easy to print registration lists to know who's coming and how much room we have in the class. Online ticket sales are great, we know when our small studio is sold out.

title: Easy to use, lots of features
name: VICKI S.
comments: Comments: the folks at Ticketpeak are extremely responsive and easy to work with. The service itself is very easy to use, both for us and for those getting seats.
pros: Pros: It fits our needs perfectly at a price that fits our budget. We don't have need for lots of features, so it is fine.
cons: Cons: Once in a while I have issues with ticket screens not showing how I expect, but fixes are pretty easy.
overall: Overall: We are able to offer ticket sales online, which has reduced the number of volunteers needed at businesses to sell in person, and helped us keep better track of ticket sales.

title: Ticket Peak Online Ticket Sales
name: Stacy T.
comments: Comments: the folks at Ticketpeak are extremely responsive and easy to work with. The service itself is very easy to use, both for us and for those getting seats.
pros: Pros: Louis Lamoureux is the absolute BEST person I've ever had the pleasure of dealing with. Instantly responsive to any question I've had and gives great advice and instruction. The product is imminently user-friendly and with Louis, very easy to setup and get started. I know that it has increased our sales even over the short period I've used it and the option to buy tickets online has not even been well publicized yet.
cons: Cons: I would like to access the event report in the "reports" section without going to the ticket page. When entering events, I would like the option of entering multiple dates for each event without having to reenter the entire event. Would like a "promotion" option which would allow a bank of numbers to be assigned which buyer could enter for discount on individual tickets.
overall: Overall: Great product at the best price. I certainly looked at many options and chose Ticket Peak. I highly recommend it to any organization. And, the service is absolutely outstanding.

title: Easy to set up. Easy for customers
name: Aaron N.
comments: Comments: the folks at Ticketpeak are extremely responsive and easy to work with. The service itself is very easy to use, both for us and for those getting seats.
pros: Pros: Ticketpeak provided summaries of purchases and sent checks in a timely manner. They are always available and helpful if you have questions or concerns.
cons: Cons: It would be nice if the software allow more flexibility in customizing your sites. It would be great to add pictures of your venue and add "themes" to your ticket ordering page. You can currently customize the tickets somewhat, but the ordering page is relatively bland .
overall: Overall: This made the job of our box office volunteer much easier. It was a great simplification of the process. We especially like not having to handle credit card information and being able to look up seating for those who forgot their tickets.

title: Mobile option not user friendly.Report options not user friendly
name: Dia H.

Pros: Ease of use when purchasing tickets (except on mobile devices)

Customizable of seat plan

Options for adding events
cons:

Limited ability to repeat info when setting up events
overall: Overall: This made the job of our box office volunteer much easier. It was a great simplification of the process. We especially like not having to handle credit card information and being able to look up seating for those who forgot their tickets.

title: We have used Ticket Peal for several years and Love all the functionality.

comments: Comments: the folks at Ticketpeak are extremely responsive and easy to work with. The service itself is very easy to use, both for us and for those getting seats.
pros: Pros: I love that we can print off reports and track payments, This enables us to run our events and performances smoother with volunteers checking tickets.
cons: Cons: When being trained to do the office administration job the website was not the easiest to navigate.
overall: Overall: It helped us run our events smoothly and track ticket sales.

title: Ticketpeak for theatres
name: Mark G.
comments: Comments: the folks at Ticketpeak are extremely responsive and easy to work with. The service itself is very easy to use, both for us and for those getting seats.
pros: Pros: system is easy to use, easy to integrate with existing online box office and company website, makes assigned seating for a venue simple and automated cutting down on our man hours for ticketing, ticket links for customers to self print works great and the system allows for on line access to check in redeem tickets at the event and search for existing purchases in the event someone forgets to bring their tickets to the theater. Events are customizable and new venues are easily uploaded to accommodate different seating charts.
cons: Cons: very few cons we have found in using Ticketpeak. There is a very slight learning curve to the system.
overall: Overall: I would definitely recommend TicketPeak. If you are looking to streamline your ticketing process for an event, have assigned seating, automate your processes and save your self time and money while at the same time creating a professional ticketing process TicketPeak is the way to go.

overall: Overall: User friendly system for our customers purchasing and families registering their kids for classes.

If I have a problem they are there to solve the problem, and the problems have only been on our side. I would certainly recommend Ticket Peak. We are thrilled.
