recommendations to other buyers: Recommendations to other buyers: Use it today!

title: Great Service for Patrons and Companies Alike!
name: Meredith S.
pros:
Pros: - Sales Format is customizable to match your website, so customers don't know they're going off-site to purchase their tickets

- Easy to add packages, products and donations to the offerings

- Easy to set up numerous shows and events throughout the year and share access to box office information to select individuals for select productions

- Ability to track all donor activity, including donations, attendance at shows, and product purchases (such as Auction wins or merchandise sales)

- Ability to sort donors by category or campaign

- Ability to have multiple donor campaigns for multiple projects

- The online format allows our Development Staff to work remotely when necessary because all donor information is on the cloud
cons: Cons: The ability to track pledges and offset them with donations is still in development. We'd like to be able to track a donation for its intended fiscal year, but that feature is not currently available. It would also be nice to be able to track Grant Deadlines and activity, as one can do with some of the more expensive programs.
overall: Overall: We've been using OvationTix since its inception. With dozens of shows throughout the year, including many for which we function purely as Presenters, the functionality of OvationTix has been crucial to our success. Our presented productions can monitor and see the success of their shows, and we can manage the overall process. We enjoy working with OvationTix so much that we began using it to track all of our donations years ago.
recommendations to other buyers: Recommendations to other buyers: It's the best, most affordable and client-friendly ticketing and development software out there!

title: Perfect! Stellar support, intuitive features, scales with us
name: Steven M.
pros:
Pros: Ease of Use

Quick Set-Up and On-Sales

Integration with Email and Website Platforms

Great Support

Helpful and Ongoing Upgrades

Call Center for Ticket Buyers by Phone

Private, Custom Branding

No Up-Front Cost: we only pay OvationTix when we sell tickets.
cons: Cons: We aren't a non-profit company, so all the fundraising features in the solution don't really apply to us. This is not a complaint really, but those tools are probably of great use to other companies. We just don't use them.
overall: Overall: Our events perform in multiple venues with varying set-ups: assigned seats, general admission, and with various types of tickets like VIPs and student pricing in venues from 99 seats up to 800 or more seats. We also use discount codes, want something that easily integrates with email software and our website and really responsive support since we produce more events than our relatively small staff can handle! OvationTix has worked very well for us in this first six months of our partnership with them. I like that they update the software monthly with new features. It is important our company keep its branding consistent and OvationTix makes that process seamless.
recommendations to other buyers: Recommendations to other buyers: Get trained on the software! It is really intuitive anyway, but training is free and you can get a lot more out of it early on if you and your staff get formally trained. It's all by phone/webinar and easy.

title: OvationTix Review
name: Jen B.
pros: Pros: The software is easy to use, allowing our patrons easy ability to purchase tickets through our site. It is also flexible, so we can adjust it to our needs as an itinerant company. We can make our subscriptions customizable to each space that we are in.
cons: Cons: The reporting function is not as straightforward as I would like. Sometimes it takes some extra finesse and creativity to pull a report with the exact information that you need. It is not as straightforward as a database as it is a ticketing software.
overall: Overall: Overall, Ovationtix is very easy to use and client friendly. They have a great support team that is easy to reach and very helpful. For a small company such as ours that does not have a stationary box office, their phone line is a great way for us to offer box office service to our patrons. It's online functionality, allowing us to use anywhere we go, is great, as we are an itinerant theater company, and need to set up a new box office area for each show, somethimes in areas that are not as conducive to a theater environment.
recommendations to other buyers: Recommendations to other buyers: Love ovationtix. They are willing to listen and work with you on anything you need, and help you figure out any aspect of their system.

title: Best Customer Support!
name: Jamie A.
pros:
Pros: -ease of use

-easy to follow layout

-everything in one spot (subscriptions, tickets, donations)
cons:
Cons: -Theatre Ed Class registrations are difficult

-no way to flag certain patrons on a who's coming list

-Patron Holds from patron profile would be nice so you are not going back and fourth from the hold page to the profile page.
overall: Overall: We love Ovationtix. Their customer support team helps us with every and any problem we have. Even if they don't have the answer right away, they get back to you within a very reasonable time frame. Everyone is always friendly and willing to help. They fully support and listen to our ideas about improving the system, in order to meet our specific needs and requirements.
recommendations to other buyers: Recommendations to other buyers: Love ovationtix. They are willing to listen and work with you on anything you need, and help you figure out any aspect of their system.

title: Side by Side development and growth
name: Allan C.
comments: Comments: As one of the busiest and most diverse theatres in the city of Chicago, the Athenaeum needed a complete ticketing and crm partner that could keep up with our volume as we continue to develop and grow. From the beginning at the first demo until today, the team at Ovationtix have met all of our challenges. They listen to the people that deal with their systems daily and willingly improve and update based on client feedback. Customer satisfaction is top drawer with Ovationtix.

title: User-friendly software and great customer support
name: Laura G.
comments: Comments: Having worked on a half-dozen different ticketing platforms, Ovationtix is the most intuitive and easiest to learn. Setting up shows with many price points and discount codes is a breeze, and even the newest BO personnel can quickly figure out the process to sell a ticket. Their customer service is responsive and knowledgeable, and they are constantly updating and upgrading the system. They let you know when they are updating, and they walk you through new features as they debut.
pros: Pros: OvationTix is a good platform/website to purchase or sell tickets on for events. It is also great for advertising and marketing your own events. They take you step by step through the ticket purchasing process, and it takes no time to complete transactions.

overall: Overall: Great
recommendations to other buyers: Recommendations to other buyers: Love ovationtix. They are willing to listen and work with you on anything you need, and help you figure out any aspect of their system.

title: Great for traditional theaters, not versatile enough for ad-hoc performances
name: Carey H.
pros: Pros: The interface is generally easy to navigate and figure out on your own. There are so many useful features, it can feel a bit cluttered, but once one learns the process, it handles every aspect of selling. The API is nice for embedding on your own site.
cons: Cons: The entire process - from setup to event management to the API - is centered around multiple performances of one run (show), as per a traditional theater. Setting up one-off shows and shows that run continuously is much more of a burden to maintain. Ad-hoc shows, especially, require that you set up a completely new event, including reminder emails, ticket setup, etc. even if that info doesn't change from show to show.
overall: Overall: The system is reliable and solid in what it does. Support does their best to help you find workarounds for non-traditional theaters, but are unwilling to consider enhancement requests without paying for the development. My one actual technical issue (notifications of credit card failure self-dismissed to quickly for the user to read) has been pretty much ignored.

title: VBO makes our ticketing accessible to all
name: Lynn V.
pros: Pros: VBO has the best support and most flexible solution to meet all of our ticketing and registration needs. After evaluating numerous Solutions, but ease-of-use during set up all the way through the user experience has been a game changer for us. We went from selling 80% of our tickets In person or at the door to selling 95% of our tickets online. This helps us forecast revenue, understand the number of volunteers we will need at events, And communicate easily with our ticket buyers before and after events. Our ticket sales have increased dramatically over the past two years
cons: Cons: After selling well over 30,000 tickets a year the number of complaints from users or ticket buyers have been able to be counted on two hands. Usually the complaint is that they don't know how to scroll down to put the tickets in the cart. That has literally been the only complaint and it happened about 10 times.
overall: Overall: We aren't entirely volunteer Ronn community theater organization. Our board, members, and patrons range in age from five years old to 90 years old. Our biggest fear was having our retired Ticket ladies be able to understand the software and still sell tickets, and our customers being able to transition to an online sale. We have had A fantastic experience with this transition and it has only become easier for us to bring our shows to the community.

title: Powerful but sometimes confusing; lots of upkeep for optimal use
name: Chris Crotty C.
pros: Pros: VBO offers a lot of features and options. Plus the company is willing (or used to be) to develop new features if you make a strong case. Ease of integration with existing sites is fairly easy. Customer support is generally quick, responsive, and thorough. The platform has never gone down in our many year use, so it's definitely stable.
cons: Cons: The interface can be confusing at times. Also, the software glitches at times when using the Box Office function, e.g., asking for full account info when you don't want to add all fields. Usually logging out and in fixes the problem. Another minor complaint: when you copy and event, it won't automatically update the "end sale" by the relative date; you have to set it manually.
overall: Overall: Runs ticketing and merchandise sales for my theater.

title: A Symphony of value
name: Paul I.
pros: Pros: We were looking for an affordable, clean, cloud-based ticketing solution. We needed to be able to let our patrons choose specific reserve seating and also enable staff to manage box office and season subscriptions. I especially like the fact that cost is entirely transactional with no upfront fees, no annual subscription or added training costs or support costs. I've also been happily surprised with the outstanding online and phone support.
cons: Cons: Onboarding was a bit difficult as there was limited formal training. However, the online tutorials are good and online/phone support is exceptional.
overall: Overall: Our experience with VBO has been outstanding!

title: Easy to use, robust and affordable
name: Peter H.
comments: Comments: This a very robust system which allows us to manage ticket and subscriptions as well as class registrations in one single platform. VBO is very cost effective given the numerous features it offers. Our organization produces 10 productions annually, as well as dozens of classes, and our summer camp program, all of which we sell through VBO.

title: VBO Tickets - A Complete Solution
name: Tyrone R.
pros: Pros: Robust features and functionality that covers many needs/requirements of today and some that may be needed in the future
cons: Cons: A little difficult to navigate
overall: Overall: CaribTix has special needs from ticket printing and online ticket sales, to mobile apps and ticket validation... The team at VBO has responded to ALL requests. One example: Several CaribTix clients use physical thermal tickets so we offer the service in addition to online ticketing, VBO was able to facilitate the import of printed thermal tickets so both physical and online tickets reside in the same database. Additionally, VBO was able to design an app to facilitate the sales, statistics and validation of all tickets online or offline. This has allowed us to provide a Closed Loop Solution for our clients.
recommendations to other buyers: Recommendations to other buyers: Design a simpler UI

title: Terrific support
name: Dorothy B.
pros: Pros: VBO created custom programs for us at no extra cost and were super responsive all along the way in our transition. It manages much more than just ticket sales - our membership program with four levels, comp tickets for our cast and crew, merchandise sales, discount prices for our members, emails to members when their memberships are going to expire and lots more.
cons: Cons: It is fairly expensive, but we have the cost added to the ticket prices as a fee. Most buyers are used to such fees and do not complain. It is fairly complex, so it is difficult to keep our box office volunteers trained to use all its functions.
overall: Overall: Ticket sales are a breeze. We are able to track memberships easily and without error, which is huge.

title: Wonderful support. Indispensable tool.
name: Franco I.
pros: Pros: Support: Extremely responsive to the customer needs.
cons: Cons: Even though it was not originally designed for class registrations we've used VBO for this. There are some things that our staff would like to see to help make things easier so it's up to us to let VBO know.
overall:
Overall: We use VBO for almost all our class registrations as well as our home season ticketed concert. The support team has been supporting us from the very beginning:

- Listening and implementing our suggestions to make the tool work for our needs.

- Always available when we need to reach them.

- Their overall passion for serving the arts community and making their product better.
recommendations to other buyers: Recommendations to other buyers: We can't recommend them enough for other organizations that are looking for a convenient and affordable way to enhance and simplify their box office needs.

title: New box office
name: Brian L.
usage: Used the software for: Less than 6 months
pros: Pros: customer service. On line and hand held user friendliness.
cons: Cons: The report structure. We need to be able to report in a more direct fashion instead of making due.
overall: Overall: We recently switched to VBO following an extended agreement with a different box office software company. The customer service features of VBO are unsurpassed. We are thrilled with the experience we are able to offer our patrons. What we are having issues with currently is the promise of a report that will help with all of our needs. We, or course, understand that all things take time and that everything good is worth waiting for. Unfortunately, we have had to make due with a hunt and peck method of reporting to both our business office and and marketing department for sales data. It is there, but it is currently far from user friendly. The staff at VBO continues to be extremely helpful in helping us find solutions to our problems, but it is not the panacea that we were hoping for. Perhaps a Christmas present of the new report is on the horizon so that the internal users can also experience the expediency that our patrons are witnessing. I still strongly recommend VBO to anyone who is interested in a box office system. I will give it an even stronger recommendation once the new report is available. Keep going, guys! The finish line must be close.

title: Best ticketing partner, ever
name: John D.
pros: Pros: Flexibility, complete feature set, sophisticated integration, ongoing product improvements, such as reporting and CRM
cons: Cons: There are some rough edges as you dig behind the scenes, but things get better month after month.
overall: Overall: Having used other ticketing services, VBO has been a strategic partner with Tabard in every sense. We have grown with them as they have continually improved the quality and functionality of software over the years. What truly stands out is their attention to personal service and making sure that things work correctly for the client, and that the client knows how to best use their immensely capable platform. I couldn't be happier with VBO.
recommendations to other buyers: Recommendations to other buyers: You can save yourself a lot of trouble and expense by going with VBO, compared with other full-featured ticketing platforms.

title: VBO is the BEST!!
name: Chris K.
pros:
Pros: Customer Service

Coding Knowledge

Wide Variety of products

Cloud based

Easy to get a hold of

Flexible

All in One ticketing (CRM, POS, Assigned and General Seating, Reporting, data tracking, discounts, donations, merchandise and more!)
cons: Cons: None.
overall: Overall: First off, the company's customer service is top notch. Whenever I had a question or suggestion, they were understanding and worked really hard to get that project done within the day! Their customer base is small so they spend time with every customer creating a customized approach to ticketing.
recommendations to other buyers: Recommendations to other buyers: This software is easy to use. Everything you need is all in this system. With the new mobile app, desktop and cloud services, this is an awesome product!

title: Powerful and Flexible
name: Achmed Rauff A.
pros:
Pros: It's immense features that enables new ways to create sales and promotions.

Fits almost all types of events at any scale.
cons:
Cons: There is a learning curve that requires sufficient training and familiarity.

Due to the sheer number of features it is easy to get overwhelmed.

A stronger build it email blast for CRM would be good to have instead on relying on 3rd party integration.
overall:
Overall: Go to market times are faster once familiar.

Support is thus far is good but we are really hoping that response times would be better.

title: A Boon For Patrons and Marketers
name: Amy R.
pros: Pros: Ease of use. Availability of information that's most important to me as a marketer.
cons: Cons: I'd like to see more videos that show me how to use the system in more advanced ways than I think of on my own. I do appreciate their available videos, however.
overall: Overall: Yea and Bravo! As the marketer in our organization, I love how easy VBO tickets is for our patrons, how seamless the experience is, how easy it is for me to integrate the VBO patron information into our marketing, and how responsive the VBO team is when I have questions.
recommendations to other buyers: Recommendations to other buyers: I like the software so much, that when I go to an event and I see an organization uses it, I think more highly of the organization.

title: Farimont Opera House Review
name: Katrina S.
pros: Pros: I like that we have the ability to use an online ticketing system, it has made our work so much easier.
cons: Cons: Sometimes when I have selected tickets and I go to apply the customer to the tickets, it essentially locks the tickets and we have to go reclaim them one by one, which can be time consuming if they are buying multiple tickets.
overall: Overall: We are saving time and giving the customers a chance to go online to purchase tickets themselves. Before it was call/ stop in only and recorded on paper.

title: Best value ticketing software, amazing management
name: Christian P.
pros: Pros: Customizability
overall: Overall: VBO Tickets has been a great partner. Senior staff is unwaveringly willing to make changes to improve the effectiveness and efficiency of their product. The software has grown by leaps and bounds since it's inception and Management continues to improve the product on an almost daily basis. The reporting function could be more robust and customizable, but if I know VBO, upgrades are probably already in the works. I consistently receive ticketing system demos to keep my options open, and truly believe that there isn't another product on the market that even comes close to what VBO offers, at this price point.

title: San Francisco Playhouse loves VBO.
name: TIiu R.
pros: Pros: Responsive, quick, user-friendly
cons: Cons: updates sometimes come with no warning, Salesforce integration has been troublesome for our development team
overall: Overall: Customer support representatives are very responsive, and if what I need isn't possible in the system, they will build it for me. It's a powerful CRM that's user-friendly, my favorite ticketing system I've used so far (I'm familiar with 3 including Tessitura.) We've been trying to integrate it with salesforce, which has been a bit of a bother, but that's not my department!
recommendations to other buyers: Recommendations to other buyers: Keep up the good work and keep making my life easier!

title: Great for Superior Control
name: Josiah F.
comments: Comments: After looking at a lot of different ticket agents we found VBO tended to be comparable price (even on the less expensive end of the spectrum) and offer the best range of control over what we can do. The best part about this company however is that if there is ever something that we needed that is not already integrated into the system their fantastic customer service agents immediately get to work getting it to work for us. The only concern that I have with them is that because of all the control that they give to us it has taken a long time to get it to work the way we want it. Overall though, fantastic!

title: Very Satisfied Community Theater User
name: Theresa D.
pros: Pros: The user friendliness is what I value most about VBO. It is extremely easy to use and to problem solve with. There are different levels of functionality so some people may use it minimally while others in your organization can learn the more in-debt features.
cons: Cons: Some of the event setup seams redundant. I wish there was a better way to copy one event into the next.
overall: Overall: It has completely changed how we do business. Our system was extremely manual and now everything is automated. In addition to using it for tickets, we use it for camp registrations as well as audition registrations. This has simplified our internal processes greatly.

title: Reliable and Flexible
name: Donny G.
pros: Pros: Flexibility, ease of use, customer service.
cons: Cons: Learning curve.
overall: Overall: As a mid-sized nonprofit theatre, VBO's services have been invaluable to us. The front-end ticketing experience is second-to-none, and we've been able to customize it to fit our needs perfectly. With our old ticketing platform, customers had to leave our website to buy tickets -- now, it's a seamless experience.

title: Great Service
name: Julia B.
pros: Pros: It's pretty easy to use. It has a lot of features. The customer service is amazing.
cons: Cons: I don't always catch when there are updates, and so sometimes I am behind on new features. I wish there was a bit more customability with the CRM aspects of the software.
overall: Overall: The VBO team is great! They are always available to assist with use of any part of the product, and they really try to customize it so it works specifically for your company.

title: Fantastic Customer Support for a Fantastic Product
name: Ben G.
pros: Pros: Ease of use, and functionality
cons: Cons: I think the UI could be a little more friendly to new users. Could be more intuitive.
overall:
Overall: I've been using VBO for over three years now and I cannot express how fantastic a program it is.

Multiple times I've called support with a question about how to do something obscure and gotten a response of "Oh, you can't do that... but give me a few hours" and before the end of the day, they have programmed in new functionality to meet my request. A+

title: Great software for the unique needs of a non-profit theatre
name: Leah A.
pros: Pros: The pop-up donation with ticket purchase, donor management.
cons: Cons: It's still not as user-friendly as I'd like from a back-end accounting perspective and reporting manipulation standpoint.
overall: Overall: I've been especially grateful for the uptake in add-on donations which is a direct result of VBO's software design that allows for a clear pop-up at time of ticket purchase. From a patron perspective, it is clean and easy to use - this hasn't always been the case with other ticketing software. The donation piece of the software has always been good, but has even improved during our tenure.

title: VBO is an Excellent Tool!
name: Jekeva P.
pros: Pros: the discounting system is great, it was really easy to create special deals. The ability to add marketing into the receipt was good.
cons: Cons: It is not a one-stop site. Things like creating a birthday club for our fans was extremely difficult. Newsletter features were very nil.
overall: Overall: If you are not computer savvy, learning VBO can be a bit daunting, but the customer service team is excellent. Each time I call them with a question, I talk to a real person who is helpful and kind. VBO is really good for tracking information and allows you to alter your ticketing info and events with ease. The mailing system for customers is OK, but they work well with other institutions such as Mailchimp to make e-newsletters a cinch. Creating pricing deals for customers is also quick and easy to do.

title: Best Customer Service.
name: Jeff K.
pros: Pros: Ease of use
overall: Overall: VBO Tickets has been the backbone of our customer experience when selling tickets online. They have created a great product and are constantly refining it with new features. Other ticket companies ignored my requests for new features or promised to "look into it." VBO has always taken our requests seriously and sometimes new feature requests are implemented within 24 hours!

title: Good option for small orgs
name: Anne Y.
comments: Comments: VBO has a lot of really great features that were not available in our previous ticketing system. We especially like the fact that their ticketing pages are embedded into our web pages so the customer sees a seamless site from start to finish. They are continually making upgrades to all areas of the software which mean they're constantly improving. Their reporting features are not as intuitive or malleable as we'd like. It would be great for them to add a custom reporting center where the client can build their own reports based on specified criteria. Hope they do that soon!

title: Best all-in-one ticketing and CRM system!
name: Sheryl Lynn T.
pros: Pros: That the software can do anything you need to do within ticketing, registration, donations, memberships and a CRM to keep track of it all!
cons: Cons: It's a good thing, but because the system does so much it can be a little complex for novice users/non-techy people.

title: Most responsive support from a company
name: Amy L.
pros: Pros: Price. Reliability
cons: Cons: Could be more user friendly on back end
overall: Overall: We have been with VBO for 3 years and have sold thousands of tickets. We have rarely had any issues and when we have we have received immediate assistance. They care about the customer and they are continually finding ways to improve the software.

title: Why do business with anyone else!
name: Susannah G.
pros: Pros: Ease of use and set up to adhere to marketing best practices.
cons: Cons: I haven't run across any yet.
overall:
Overall: Big business with personal, customized support! Time after time with various ticketing needs I have turned to VBO and been impressed with their professional, quick training, support, help and even the ability to create features and functions that didn't previously exist. Ticketing

is hard and specific and ever changing but VBO has hit it out of the park every time; addressing challenges and coming up with the best short and long term solutions I've seen anywhere. Affordable and able to take on small or large jobs, it's my go to ticketing solution for their technically advanced product, user friendliness, and brilliant customer support. From small performing arts shows, to subscriptions, to large concert halls, Festivals, Zoo fundraising events and Corporate Conference dine-arounds, there's no environments or tasks they didn't take on for me with reliable, flawless execution. I've used several well know ticketing solutions both back and front end and my favorite is VBO for sure.
recommendations to other buyers: Recommendations to other buyers: My review says it all, it really is a solution, customizable, efficient and technically sound.

title: Music City Male Revue
name: Shawn C.
pros: Pros: It works every time my Customers want to purchase tickets . Once I Locate on the site it's very simple to add more tickets.
cons: Cons: We have a very hard time navigating the tasks we want to do. However if any questions come up VBO are always helpful in showing us the steeps.
overall: Overall: The system works and they have helped us sellout almost every weekend.

title: CMT loves VBO
name: Dana Z.
comments: Comments: We value our relationship with VBO. They have helped our organization carefully plan for registration and ticket purchases, updating reports and forms needed to serve our organization. The VBO team is responsive and offers good client support.

title: What A Treasure!
name: Sheryl Lynn T.
pros: Pros: Customization
cons: Cons: Need some experience with computers/software
overall: Overall: VBO has been an amazing addition to our online experience for our customers! The system is robust yet user friendly and the VBO staff is a pleasure to work with.

title: Fantastic Service That Keeps Getting Better
name: Bill H.
pros: Pros: VBO Tickets is well rounded and can ultimately be shaped to be a solution for anything you need to get done. I have always been able to implement changes to my sales, and when I can't find the solution myself, the support team is always able to quickly let me know what to do.
cons: Cons: As an ever improving service, sometimes you can get confused by older demos and setups.
overall: Overall: I've been selling tickets with VBO for nearly a year and I'm glad to be doing so!

title: VBO Tickets - Great software for nonprofits!
name: Aimee Z.
comments: Comments: We just started with VBO last summer for our outdoor summer theater festival that has over 14,000 attendees in 8 weeks of performances. VBO staff were able to get us up and running in under two weeks, which was AMAZING. (Although I wouldn't recommend that timeline to anyone -- but they can do it!) The software is very user friendly to our patrons who had no trouble moving to a new user experience, and from the back end, with very little training, our entire staff was able to sell tickets over the phone successfully. The back end reporting does need a little help, but the company has worked hard over the last year to improve the functionality, and I am pleased with what the software is able to do now for us with regard to sales reports and data. Overall, I think it's a great ticketing / subscription / member software for the price and staff support. We researched five other CRM systems this fall and ended up sticking with VBO. I would highly suggest a demo with the company to see if it fits into what you need. And if you're not sure, they seem willing to customize the process so it works for you. Would be great for museums, theater companies, symphonies, ballets, operas, who operate year round, but also for music festivals, etc that need it on the occasional basis.

title: Excellent service & very responsive
name: Dave G.
pros: Pros: Easy to navigate behind the scenes, from the dashboard to all the specific areas.
cons: Cons: Would maybe like a few more options, easily customizable, with how ticket options are presented graphically on our own website.
overall: Overall: We have been working with VBO for several years now. When the inevitable issue pops up, they have always been super quick to respond, and very attentive until all is resolved. We have been very happy, and expect to continue using VBO well into the future.

title: Great Ticketing Software, Great Customer Support
name: Don M.
comments: Comments: VBO is always responsive to my requests and customer support issues, which is very important when using software that is central to your business.

title: LOVE VBO - a lot
name: Kasey K.
pros:
Pros: Intervention

Flexibility

Ease of use

Customer service
cons: Cons: Didn't switch sooner
overall: Overall: VBO has dramatically improved our ticket integration on our website and cut our manual backend work in half! Literally. And their customer support has been outstanding
recommendations to other buyers: Recommendations to other buyers: Very very happy

title: Easy to Work With!
name: Lauren D.
usage: Used the software for: Less than 6 months
pros: Pros: There are tons of great things about VBO. I love that it looks very professional and easily integrates with our existing website. The backend platform is fairly easy to navigate once you get familiar with it, and there are tons of ways to customize your events.
cons: Cons: You do sometimes have to jump around a bit as certain features only exist in certain places (you cannot create a new event pricing template from the event creation section, for example), but once you understand the flow it's pretty quick and easy to use.
overall: Overall: The sales and customer support team at VBO are great. They're always easy to get in touch with and very helpful. Getting started with their services only took a few days and was really painless!

title: Not Always Practical
name: Luke W.
pros: Pros: I like that we were able to seamlessly integrate it within our website.
cons: Cons: The small things that don't make sense for us (i.e. ordering of shows in drop down menus), inability to customize for our specific needs.
overall: Overall: It's been okay, but hard to get in touch for immediate contact without having a VBO support phone number and having to email only.

title: Super Easy and Responsive
name: Laurel B.
pros: Pros: Easy to use- both for our guests and on the back end. Enough bells and whistles to be useful, but not so many that it's all just too bewildering.
cons: Cons: I haven't yet figured out a way to de-segment guests from donors when it comes to targeting email addresses, but I'm sure it's doable.
overall: Overall: We have used VBO for the past few years as the ticketing platform for my nonprofit organization's signature event, the Hoot & Howl. This party pulls in a guest list topping 750 people, and I really appreciate being able to use a friendly interface for both paid tickets and consignment tickets (for our sponsors). My technical assistance questions are always answered promptly, we receive electronic invoices in a timely fashion, our guests find VBO easy to use, and it's a tremendous help when it comes to check-in the night of the event, as well.

title: VBO Tickets Changed my business
name: Mike D.
comments: Comments: With the help and support of the VBO staff this software has completely changed the way we do business and has more than paid for itself. The staff is always more than willing to help out with anything they can do.

title: Outstanding Customer Support
name: Bea R.
position: Project Manager & Women Entrepreneurship Conference Director
pros: Pros: The ability to create recurring events, and to pull various kinds of reports.
cons: Cons: It's not intuitive (for example, to change the venue of an event, I have to remember to go "Manage Event Dates") and still am having trouble syncing to Constant Contact. I use Customer Support often, who have been extremely helpful.
overall: Overall: The best part of my experience with VBO is the exceptional customer support. Ben, in particular, is highly responsive and dependable. The video tutorials are helpful, and they can troubleshoot pretty quickly.

title: VBO
name: MICHAEL D.
pros: Pros: Easy to use. This software takes the guess work out of selling tickets online
cons: Cons: It's a little on the pricey side. We are a very small theater and it ended up being a little too expensive for us
overall: Overall: Customer service through VBO was amazing. They help walk you through every step so it makes set up and delivery of your products super easy

title: VBO Tickets ROCKS!
name: Ed E.
usage: Used the software for: Less than 6 months
pros: Pros: Extremely user friendly. Absolutely TERRIFIC customer/user support.
cons: Cons: N/A - Seriously, none that I can think of at the moment that is VBO Tickets' issue. I wish that Square was a little easier for them to work with, but that is NOT their issue.
overall: Overall: As the Executive Director for Hawaii Children's Theatre, I can say that we have had an absolutely exceptional experience with VBO Tickets. From our first contact with the company to setting up the site and linking it to our own website, to brilliant customer service and support, to well...everything. We have had a great experience. Additionally, my assistant has given me extremely positive feedback about all of her interactions with VBO Tickets and has relayed to me that the response time for addressing any of her questions has been incredible, so much so that she told another community theater company about our experience. Because of our experience, they too are excited about building a new partnership with VBO Tickets. Thank you very much for everything that you have done for us. We look forward to our continued partnership and growth with VBO Tickets!
recommendations to other buyers: Recommendations to other buyers: None that I can think of at the moment. Please keep up the terrific work!

title: The BEST Ticking Service We've Found
name: Carter W.
usage: Used the software for: Less than 6 months
pros: Pros: Customer service, ease of use, low service fees, prompt response, website integration
cons: Cons: It has it's minor bugs but they ALWAYS look into them when you bring it to their attention
overall: Overall: As a small nonprofit community theatre, ticketing services can often be way more complicated than what we need. When we discovered, we were not aware just how amazing they would be at customizing our experience for our small theatre. The customer service ALONE is worth the cost of use. If I ever have a question on how to do something and can't figure it out, they always respond promptly with more information than I would normally expect. I cannot recommend VBO Tickets enough, they're AMAZING!

title: All-In-One ticketing
name: Verified Reviewer
pros: Pros: This is a cloud based platform that uses advanced tech to help plan the most advanced events. This is great to use for an event where you want different type of seating
cons: Cons: This is great service! No cons here. works great for events.
overall: Overall: Overall it is my go to ticket experience for any events and can embed directly onto my website for advanced and GA seating.

title: Awesome Business Partner
name: Sandy C.
pros: Pros: Flexibility and client ease of use
cons: Cons: Not always the easiest to configure on the business side
overall: Overall: VBO is always innovating! Their customer support team is quick to get the answers your business needs and to solve your challenges.

title: Amazing quality and support
name: Dottie B.
comments: Comments: VBO's willingness and ability to create special programs for us, a small community theater, continues to amaze me. It has allowed us to move our service up another level, and to rely less on one person (me) so that I can envision passing the ticketing/membership function on to someone else. The only suggestion I would make is that structure is needed in the overall training program. I am now at the point where I am wrestling with reconciling sales in VBO/Stripe/my bank account/chart of accounts and it is very difficult and non-uniform. Key information that I need (what was purchased - a subscription or tickets, and tickets to what event) are not passed over into Stripe, so I have to do a cumber reconcile process in order to allocate a deposit among the various bookkeeping accounts. I would suggest a chat feature. Stripe has it and it has really helped when I have questions.

title: VBO Tickets is Great!
name: Stefanie W.
pros: Pros: Customer experience & POS for box office operators (ever-changing set of volunteers), Feature-rich, web embeds, cloud-based
cons: Cons: slow printing still a problem at Paly box office.
overall: Overall: Very powerful and flexible system. Love that it is cloud-based & updates are FAST & continual. Excellent cashier/box office system for operators & POS experience for patrons. Seamless & good-looking embed on ticketing webpage. Longer learning curve for main admin person, but that comes with depth of features. Excellent phone customer service: shout-out to the customer support! Excited about app for sales & scan management in cellular-only environments. Good how-to vids; keep going with more, please. Looking forward to those reporting upgrades, too.
recommendations to other buyers: Recommendations to other buyers: Wish I could reach customer service folks on weekends when we have shows.

title: We love VBO!
name: Patrick S.
comments: Comments: VBO ties into our website; we especially like the gift and loyalty card features that allow us to customize those experiences for our fans. The discount flexibility helps us out a lot, and VBO even built the ability to authorize, but not charge cards until we review the transaction - allowing our fans to change their orders up until the day of show. This is viewed by group purchasers as exceptionally flexible, and great customer service on our part. VBO made it possible.

title: Excellent customizable platform.
name: Lawrence L.
pros: Pros: The customizability
cons: Cons: Complexity
overall: Overall: The ticketing for my show is complex, but customer service agent and his team really go beyond to meet my needs. The platform gets a bit cumbersome and confusing, but they are patient and help walk me through every time I have a question. There are a few bugs that I've found with regards to how I need my ticketing to work, but I'm sure they will be addressed.

title: VBO Review
name: Max C.
usage: Used the software for: Less than 6 months
pros: Pros: The software is fairly flexible and has a very clean interface; both for patrons and theatre staff. The template function makes creating events extremely efficient.
cons: Cons: A lot of the neat tricks VBO can pull off are not inherently explained. Some features are only applicable to general admission shows and not assigned seating shows (like group sales: 10+ tickets bought at once) and vice versa.

title: One SJWS user
name: Charles M.
pros: Pros: No bugs. Has lots of user options for getting sales reports.
cons: Cons: Some menus hard to figure out initially. Some "lists" of customer orders print out awkwardly.
overall: Overall: Generally quite positive. Some of the menus are confusing, but once familiar with them, the information I need is easily available. I have experienced no bugs in my interactions with the software.
recommendations to other buyers: Recommendations to other buyers: We have used it for several years now. It is much better than what we used before. As a small non-profit musical organization, it suits our needs very well.

title: Excellent customer service!
name: Jordan B.
comments: Comments: We have used VBO for almost 2 years and they are incredibly responsive and helpful! Anytime I need help, they not only fix what I need but also give me the knowledge to make complicated changes on my own. I never expected to learn coding aspects from my ticketing software company!

title: Brilliant offering
name: Gregg F.
usage: Used the software for: Less than 6 months
pros: Pros: VBO Tickets had been by far the easiest and most user friendly online ticketing system I have made use of.
cons: Cons: There was nothing I didn't like about the platform.
overall: Overall: I am utilising VBO for the bands I manage and it has been by far the best platform we have had the opportunity to work on.

title: VBO works great for us
name: Lisa M.
pros:
Pros: Customizability

Easy of use for the end user

Customer support
cons: Cons: Sometimes it is hard to find the setting I am looking for in the admin site
overall: Overall: We have had a great experience with VBO. The system has all the functionality we need. It is very customizable. If we every need help figuring out how to make the system work the way we need the customer support is very responsive.

title: VBO makes my business possible
name: Clayton W.
comments: Comments: I've been using virtual box office for over 3 years now and I can say without a doubt that if they didn't exist tomorrow my business would be in a bad way. We run between 25 and 45 different events every month and the ability to have those auto-populate to our website is a necessity. Also the staff at VBO is VERY responsive. I've asked for added features and the turn around is typically less than a week. I know I'm not asking for anything crazy, but I have trouble even responding to an email that fast. These guys are great, and they really care about my business. You'll like them.

title: We LOVE VBO
name: Erin G.
pros: Pros: The amazing amount of options we have to use.
cons: Cons: It's not super user friendly.
overall: Overall: Vbo Tickets is an amazing company with customer service to match. The software is complex, but they will walk you through anything you need and we have been so happy with the functionality of what we can do.

title: Great software, wonderfully responsive company
name: Andrew B.
comments: Comments: We've been working with VBO Tickets for several years and have been nothing but happy. The software is extremely flexible and configurable, allowing us to sell tickets for shows and workshps, with add-ons like merchandise and snacks.

title: We love it, but want to grow with it!
name: Kat B.
pros: Pros: Love the people that run it, Love the support. love the easy of use
cons: Cons: Wish that the App was a little more functional.
overall: Overall: We have been using VBO since pretty much the start of our business, and right as they were launching theirs. I think that we have grown as much as they have, and sometimes I wish there was more support for specific functions that seem easy to fix. The support is good-- we get responses back, but sometimes I wish the action actually went through a little more.

title: Functional, Flexible, and Fast Customer Service
name: Chris C.
comments: Comments: VBO offers a highly functional and flexible platform for managing ticket sales.There are many useful options for organizations of all types and sizes. Customer service is very quick, and VBO is often willing to add or modify functionality based on client input. The system interface can be a bit overwhelming at first, but VBO provides as much training as you need. And the price could be lower given an increasingly competitive market. Other providers are catching up at lower prices.

title: VBO Tickets services for the Steinway Society of the Bay Area
name: Jeanne S.
comments: Comments: The online ticketing service Steinway Society of the Bay Area used prior to switching over to VBO Tickets was not growing with our changing needs. The VBO Tickets staff addressed our priorities, concerns, and future needs and seamlessly got us up-to-speed so we didn't miss a beat during the middle of our busy season. We're excited about all the features that are available to us as we expand our marketing and customer base. Thanks VBO!

title: They need to provide a manual
name: Georgie H.
comments: Comments: Customer service was excellent and always available and very much appreciated by me, a not so tech savvy person. But, the website feature access is not intuitive and requires a lot of instruction as to why one should click that to get that report. Other than calling in there are no on-site instructions on how to do specific things. I would use the company again but will need a manual.

title: Great Software and Support
name: Kent T.
comments: Comments: Our band has used VBO for many concerts over the past 5-6 years with great results. We've used assigned seating twice with zero errors. The amazing thing about VBO is their superb customer support --- always there to help in any way they can. They have truly helped our band get to the next level and help us maximize our audience. We highly recommend this service.

title: Welcome to the 21st Century
name: Brad W.
comments: Comments: VBO has been a great addition to the company. It makes it easy for us to keep track of sales and to quickly add events to our website so that tickets can be purchased easily online. There were a few things that we struggled figuring out how to do, but, thanks to the great customer service, we quickly and easily navigated those problems.

title: VBO knows what they're doing
name: Phil W.
comments: Comments: We've sold tickets to our events on a number of platforms, most of which were just fine. But VBO actually helped design a platform for us, taking into account what our company needed. So naturally we use that one now. They're easy to reach and will work through issues with you on the phone. And they're good guys.

title: Fantastic Ticketing software
name: Frankie B.
comments:
Comments: VBO is easy to use, reasonably intuitive once you learn the software and looks incredibly crisp.

Even better, any time we have a question or suggestion of any sort, the team at VBO is quick to respond. They are knowledgeable and tremendously easy to work with for all your ticketing needs.

title: VBO provides great customizing and customer service
name: Amy A.
comments: Comments: VBO's strengths lie in their amazing customer service and willingness to customize for any scale of customer needs. Their product allows us to embed the ticketing within our event website too, which is a plus for our organization's needs and goals.

title: VBO Review!
name: Alice F.
comments: Comments: VBO has been pretty great to work with! It's a new system, so the support has been awesome about trying to get us the information we need if it's something different than what had been anticipated when creating the software.

title: Excellent small, growing ticketing provider
name: Brian K.
comments: Comments: The team at VBO is responsive and great, the software is excellent on the user end, and getting better on the back end (reports and all) Tons of potential here and some excellent innovation!

title: Ed Trout VBO Review
name: Edward T.
comments: Comments: We have been using VBO for a few years now, and have been satisfied overall with the product. When there have been issues, we usually get a swift response to the problem at hand.

title: VBO is great
name: Emily P.
comments: Comments: I have worked on the VBO systems for many years. It is easy to use and love how they can make something that we request very easily and quickly.

title: VBO is awesome
name: Verified Reviewer
pros: Pros: I totally recommend VBO. They can help you and your business with so many things. In so many different ways. It's unreal.
cons: Cons: The cons to this software are it's few limitations. This is the only thing(s) holding VBO back.

title: Great overall
name: jason w.
comments: Comments: great! we enjoy it. would like to see some visual, image based calendar options. so yeah, good stuff!

title: All-in-One Package for your Ticketing Needs!
name: William B.
usage: Used the software for: Less than 6 months
pros: Pros: Great integration with mobile and tablet devices and a great feature set that doesn't leave anything out, including selling merchandise and memberships.
cons: Cons: Even with personalized pricing, they couldn't beat our current ticketing CRM.

title: Hello
name: Anh Tuan H.
pros: Pros: Ease of use and navigation, toolbar on the lefthand side made it all organized.
cons: Cons: All the options available made it a little confusing at first.
overall: Overall: It's been great working with team.

title: Selling tickets
name: Ivan G.
usage: Review is based on a free trial
pros: Pros: What I liked most about this software was the ease of the setup.
cons: Cons: My least favorable function was a little freezing. Not consistent at all
overall: Overall: My overall experience was excellent! I would recommend to any person or company looking for easy online presence.

title: Easy to use ticketing tool
name: Verified Reviewer
pros: Pros: The reporting system is very well thought out. We have at our disposal at least 20 various reports. Graphical (bar chart with division into period, size and sales channel) is very convenient for people who have seen this for the first time. The new functionality Transaction Tracking" can be used for tracking of active transactions: with the division into statuses, payment methods, dates and transaction owners.
cons: Cons: I do not see at this moment. There is nothing about the new software that I dislike
overall: Overall: With Roboticket, we have been successfully cooperating since 2015, we can see how the system develops and we can recommend it to all those who want to efficiently handle sale by cash and sale via internet.

title: Comprehensive state-of-the-art sports ticketing system with great flexibility
name: Nicolaus P.
pros:
Pros: Flexible in its use and changes are developed super fast.

Roboticket reflects state-of-the-art ticketing for sports clubs that want to be independent from old-fashioned companies. That includes: total data ownership, customization and digital distribution.
cons: Cons: Not too much to mention here. At the beginning, we had to put more effort into translating the whole tool into our market's language.
overall: Overall: From small clubs to Champions League participants - Roboticket facilitates all aspects of ticketing operations. Even for inexperienced users it provides thorough and easy to understand features.

title: Review of a user, cashier and administrator
name: Pawel B.
pros: Pros: Using the software is intuitive and does not pose a major problem.
cons: Cons: Ticket printing software sometimes hangs, especially on weaker computers.
overall: Overall: From small clubs to Champions League participants - Roboticket facilitates all aspects of ticketing operations. Even for inexperienced users it provides thorough and easy to understand features.

title: Great Software with wide range of possibilities
name: Maciej P.
pros:
Pros: The main advantage of this software is a multitude of options, that makes this product very flexible.

This makes it possible for you to customize the product to your individual needs.
cons:
Cons: At the beginning this software seems to be a little bit complicated in terms of configuration.

However it's easy to learn the basics and after few weeks you can working without problems.
overall: Overall: From small clubs to Champions League participants - Roboticket facilitates all aspects of ticketing operations. Even for inexperienced users it provides thorough and easy to understand features.

title: Advanced and intuitive ticketing tool
name: John M.
usage: Review is based on a free trial
pros:
Pros: This ticketing system is really "smart" - it's intuitive, there is nothing superfluous. Being able to manage this system saves a huge amount of time.

Three the most important and useful tools for me:

1. easy reporting system to manage a sale

2. loyalties programs to boosting a sale

3. mobile app, easy in use to buy a ticket and get into the stadium using barcode
cons: Cons: None really. Can't wait to see what comes next.
overall: Overall: I would highly recommend.

title: Fast, easy and worth recommending
name: Peter F.
pros: Pros: Buying a ticket is very simple and fast. Access to your account and tickets via the website has always worked without any problems. The website looks nice and intuitive.
cons: Cons: I do not know if this is a matter of GSM coverage or the page itself, but the page on the mobile device works a little slower than on a computer.
overall: Overall: I would highly recommend.

title: A 21st century solution for a growing arts organization
name: David L.
pros: Pros: We worked with Patron Technology to migrate 12 years of ticketing/membership/donation transactions to PatronManager CRM in 2015. The technical staff, many of whom have direct working experience in nonprofit arts organizations, understood our goals completely and tailored the application for our unique requirements. The support team is knowledgeable, responsive and dedicated to our success.
cons: Cons: PatronManager CRM requires a training investment by the staff and leadership to get the most out of the product. This is true of any new system -- but there is a terrific reward to making that investment of time.
overall: Overall: PatronManager CRM has helped us gain a more complete insight to our patron relationships, and is invaluable in recording details of our patrons, donors and members. We have used this information to grow our earned and contributed revenue. The tools provided by PatronManager have made several staff positions more productive, and more satisfied in their jobs.

title: We have been using PM for 2 years and learn something new everyday.
name: Nicole L.
pros: Pros: We have seen our single tickets increase dramatically with online capabilities, which we didn't have until starting with PM. Support staff has been very responsive. Having the system has cleaned up a lot of previous human error as we took reservations on handwritten forms for the prior TWENTY NINE years. With VoIP phones and this cloud based ticketing system we have the ability to allow BO staff to work form home when needed - answering phones and making reservations as if they were sitting in the office.
cons: Cons: Subscribers with flexible packages can not go online to make individual show reservations. That is very unfortunate for us with over 5,000 subscribers in non-traditional subscription packages. Reporting take a bit of time to get used to. We are still double checking each other's list pulls to be confident they are correct. I also find there are some traditionally standard BO operations that can't be done, which frustrates me. I don't think the system should dictate how we do business. I suggest you appoint or hire a systems administrator as your go to person on staff. They'll have a lot to learn, program and continue to maintain. Our Audience Services Manager dedicates, on average, 8 hours a week to system administration.
overall: Overall: Increased sales. Online sales capabilities. Less human error in making reservations and a quick "checks and balances" with confirmation emails. No surprises at curtain of patrons being booked into the wrong night. Faster reservation making because there is no more handwriting. Much more accurate sales reporting. Sales that tie into our accounting figures.

title: We've been using PatronManager for four years; the system has been nothing short of transformational
name: Amy W.
pros: Pros: Comprehensiveness: We now conduct all our business through PatronManager including ticket sales, marketing, development, education, and a national tour. This has been transformational for our ability to segment our audience and communicate in a truly personalized way with all our patrons and donors.
cons: Cons: Due to PatronManager's fast growth, there have been times when tech support response times have been extended. However, when that has happened, PatronManager has always moved quickly to make necessary changes and communicated with customers openly about the challenges and the timeline.
overall: Overall: It has facilitated significant growth in ticket sales and fundraising by making it possible for us to have a 360 degree view of everyone in our database.

title: Could not do my job without PatronManager
name: Arieal W.
pros: Pros: Overall this is a great program. The CRM aspect is important and of course useful, but the most impactful part of the program for our organization is reporting. We would not be able to effectively run our business without the many reporting options available in this program. We can compare sales year over year, create campaigns for marketing and development, and so on. All layers of the database including ticket sales and donations speak to each other so we can pull reports for almost anything. Not to mention, if I do not know how to do something the support team will assist me. My background is customer service and the Patron Manager team exceed my expectations. They are extremely helpful and knowledgeable. They are great teachers. I also like how this program is customizable. There are tons of additional applications (some paid, mostly free) that can be added to PatronManager. These additional applications are very helpful. I recently downloaded one that will allow me to manage our volunteer program. Its truly a lifesaver.
cons: Cons: One con is the response time for support. We do have the ability to mark the urgency of a support request, and they will respond immediately for urgent requests, but it would be nice to get a quicker response for even non urgent matters. Sometimes the little issues are still a big deal.
overall: Overall: It has facilitated significant growth in ticket sales and fundraising by making it possible for us to have a 360 degree view of everyone in our database.

title: The best software! Makes my job much easier, with its ease of use and dependability.
name: Jessica P.
pros: Pros: Love that we can customize almost anything to meet our unique needs. Ease of reporting, either using pre-made reports that come built in, or by customizing our own for specific details. Features are constantly being added - a highlight of any month is reading through Release Notes! Because my department is so small, I have come to depend on PM to house institutional knowledge that would otherwise be lost if even one member of our team left the organization. Building and managing inventory could not be easier. Love that I can customize email templates - has made invoicing directly from PM so easy. Chatter makes communicating with our student staff a breeze, and I love that I am able to work from home using PatronManager when weather or school closings are an issue. Have wifi, will travel.
cons: Cons: There definitely has to be someone on staff who can be an admin that is well versed in most of the smaller troubleshooting issues, so that you're not constantly relying on PM Support. However, the online training and help modules are so robust, that this is not a problem. There is always help available, either online, or through the fantastic client services department that handles support requests.
overall: Overall: It has facilitated significant growth in ticket sales and fundraising by making it possible for us to have a 360 degree view of everyone in our database.

title: Using PatronManager has allowed us to integrate everything we do, despite having no central office.
name: Verified Reviewer
pros: Pros: Truly an integrated CRM system that allows us to see what our members and non-members are doing. All-volunteer organization has some unique processes, and we have been able to customize PatronManager to accommodate our show attendance invitation system, for example. Also, because it's cloud-based and, once set up, most user procedures are fairly straight-forward, we've been able to decentralize a number of data management tasks. Committees manage their own data, rather than one database administrator (also volunteer) needing to be responsible for all collection and reporting. We also like the ability to clone donation forms (non-complex ones) ourselves, to customize them for specific purposes.
cons: Cons: Developing reports is more challenging than many of our members can handle technically, so that remains largely the purview of a very small number of people (1-2). Implementation was generally smooth, despite some (inevitable) resistance to change. If there are multiple people qualifying donations and ticket orders, that process needs to be actively managed. Without active management, qualification can get a back-log, which (appropriately) results in temporary dupes in the system.
overall: Overall: It has facilitated significant growth in ticket sales and fundraising by making it possible for us to have a 360 degree view of everyone in our database.

title: Very robust CRM system perfect for Non-Profit Theatre Company
name: Keith R.
pros: Pros: Patron Manager stores all of our ticketing and donor data in a single database which allows us to create reports and mailing lists from a single source rather than pulling records from multiple excel spreadsheets. Their customer service and online help is world class, and keeps getting better each year with additional webinars and added content. Their process for keeping the database 'clean' is very helpful and avoids the duplication of records. The product is stable. Downtime is almost non-existent - we've had perhaps 3 incidents over 5 years of not being able to access the database and even then it was for a very short period of time with minor-to-no impact to operations.
cons: Cons: The only 'negative' about the product was during our initial setup. The ease of data import was over-hyped. Templates were provided but the brunt of the work had to be done by us. This was five years ago and I'm going to guess they have found processes to make it easier for their customers to import data. All of this said, once they received the templates populated with our data the database was set up correctly.
overall: Overall: It has facilitated significant growth in ticket sales and fundraising by making it possible for us to have a 360 degree view of everyone in our database.

title: Glad we made the change Glad we made the change to Patron Manager
name: Jeff F.
pros: Pros: We took a long time (three years) in exploring ticketing/fundraising CRM options knowing that the shift in systems was going to be a major change for our organization. We are so glad that we chose Patron Manager and Salesforce. It is truly a system that will grow as our organization grows (and it is helping us in that growth!). We now have access to information and data in ways that were not possible with our previous systems. The support team has been very helpful in solving problems and guiding us in different directions as we test the limits of what we want to do. Our team is fired up to utilize Patron Manager and Salesforce and are eager to learn more.
cons: Cons: Reporting can be a bit of a challenge as it requires some very specific thinking about how to find what you want to know. Even after using the product for several years, I still feel like I'm not fluent in reporting.
overall: Overall: Easier access to data about our patrons. We can now make better fact-based data decisions rather than relying upon hunch.

title: User-Friendly Functionality & Incredible Customer Support
name: Scott G.
pros: Pros: If you can send an email and/or use Facebook, you can master software platform of PatronManager! Not only are the functions laid out in an easy-to-use, organized fashion, but the visual aesthetic of the program itself makes it almost self-explanatory. And if you have any questions, simply visit the PatronManager Help tab, where you can find step-by-step how-to's on almost any PatronManager feature or "Submit a Support Request."
cons: Cons: Although the "Reports" feature is quite robust, especially along with CRM Snapshot options, but the sorting "Fields" are not available for every report. (Work-arounds usually do the trick.)
overall: Overall: Again, not only is it easy to use and nice to look at from a user perspective, but it also allows for remote access, which helps make it THE BEST ticketing software I've ever had the pleasure of using in all of my 10+ box office sales experience!

title: 350 delivered!
name: Michael S.
pros: Pros: The team at PatronTechnology is knowledgeable, collaborative, and has even helped our IT department understand and use the salesforce.com platform in new ways. We implemented nearly four years ago now, and we have very much enjoyed continuing to grow with them. PM got us that much closer to a true 360-degree view of our patrons, donors, alumni, students, parents, listeners, employees, and volunteers. Plus, it's on the Salesforce platform which means it's secure, fast, and reliable, as well as scalable and configurable.
cons: Cons: Honestly, there's not much to dislike. There are a few minor aspects that I wish were more configurable for our environment, but we have workarounds for them so not a large negative impact.
overall: Overall: Again, not only is it easy to use and nice to look at from a user perspective, but it also allows for remote access, which helps make it THE BEST ticketing software I've ever had the pleasure of using in all of my 10+ box office sales experience!

title: Great CRM solution for ticketing and development.
name: Michael W.
pros: Pros: That it is a cloud-based CRM - it is wonderful to have our Ticket Sales, Donations History, and Marketing history all in one place. PatronManager has been able to help us do more and is very customize-able. CRM snapshots (easy way to run quick list like show me ticket buyers that came to X show but not bought tickets for Y show yet).
cons: Cons: There is a learning curve in creating your own customized reports as the reporting structure is very robust. The payoff is worth the learning curve as you can create reports on just about anything. (There are canned reports and CRM Snapshots which are easy to use right off the bat.)
overall: Overall: It is fantastic

title: PatronManager enables our small staff to thrive with CRM - so agile and efficient!
name: Emily H.
pros: Pros: All information on donations, marketing, and ticketing is in one place! You can look at a person's PatronManager account and really see a snapshot of that patron's interactions with the Ballet...from their last ticket order to their recent meeting with the development team. So helpful, especially for our small staff!
cons: Cons: Because the possibilities in Salesforce are so vast, things can be overwhelming upon first adoption for non-tech-minded people. The PM team helps you customize anything you want and the annual conferences in NYC are super helpful to see how other organizations and teams are using the Salesforce platform.
overall: Overall: It is fantastic

title: User with 3 years experience
name: Richard M.
pros: Pros: This is an excellent, robust ticketing system that lets us run our entire company in Salesforce, the world's leading CRM. All our data are in one place!
cons: Cons: PatronManager has a big impact on your Salesforce instance. It will be the signature feature governing how your CRM works. While sometimes you will find this to be good and helpful, at others you'll find it can complicate development of your own Salesforce customizations.
overall: Overall: It lets us run our entire company in Salesforce, keeping all our data in one place!

title: Can't love it enough.
name: David B.
pros: Pros: Customization. If the software doesn't have what you need out of the box, they will build something custom for you (or you can build it yourself!) and they're always updating the software with new features to improve ease of use or give more powerful options.
cons: Cons: You really do need an admin on the staff who will be in charge of maintaining the software from your side. That staff person should learn as much about the software as they can to troubleshoot minor problems in-house so you won't need their support system for small things.
overall: Overall: We've seen immediate increases of both ticket sales AND donation revenue.

title: Great for all aspects of our organization!
name: Dan M.
pros: Pros: The greatest thing is the flexibility to customize the software to suit your needs. This allows us to handle a number of different sales processes and keep looking for ways to improve how our organizations interactions with guests.
cons: Cons: Also the customization, since it really requires someone to take ownership of the system and can make support tricky since every business does things differently
overall: Overall: We've seen immediate increases of both ticket sales AND donation revenue.

title: I have enjoyed the past 4 years using PatronManager!
name: Evan V.
pros: Pros: Excellent support staff, in-depth training resources at your fingertips, robust reporting, and the ability to customize the system to meet your needs all adds up to a powerful CRM that I highly recommend.
cons: Cons: It can be very daunting learning the reporting side of the system but once you have a firm grasp on the terminology and how reporting works, the system becomes very enjoyable to use.
overall: Overall: We've seen immediate increases of both ticket sales AND donation revenue.

title: PatronManager - A Comprehensive Solution for Ticket Sales and Donor Management
name: Robert J.
comments: Comments: The Townsend Center for the Performing Arts is now in its second season with PatronManager. The system is built on the SalesForce Platform, which is the leading CRM and database platform used by most of the Fortune 500 companies.
pros: Pros: Excellent support staff, in-depth training resources at your fingertips, robust reporting, and the ability to customize the system to meet your needs all adds up to a powerful CRM that I highly recommend.
cons: Cons: It can be very daunting learning the reporting side of the system but once you have a firm grasp on the terminology and how reporting works, the system becomes very enjoyable to use.
overall: Overall: We've seen immediate increases of both ticket sales AND donation revenue.

title: Great to have one database that gives us a complete picture of our customer
name: Lee Ann B.
position: Marketing & Public Relations Director/Group Sales Director
comments: Comments: The Townsend Center for the Performing Arts is now in its second season with PatronManager. The system is built on the SalesForce Platform, which is the leading CRM and database platform used by most of the Fortune 500 companies.
pros: Pros: What we used to do in three databases and a couple of spreadsheets is now in one: ticket purchases, donations, volunteer experience, class registrations
cons: Cons: The class registration "module" is the second or third app we've tried. It's good, but still not a seamless integration.
overall: Overall: We've seen immediate increases of both ticket sales AND donation revenue.

title: PatronManager Review
name: Joel N.
usage: Review is based on a free trial
comments: Comments: The Townsend Center for the Performing Arts is now in its second season with PatronManager. The system is built on the SalesForce Platform, which is the leading CRM and database platform used by most of the Fortune 500 companies.
pros: Pros: Being a software that is all about donations, fundraising, ticket sales and anything that comes close to event revenue, I would really recommend it for it's reliability in boosting tickets sales and tracking every activity accordingly, accuracy and minimal human error, efficient booking and managing mails for campaigns or customer update.
cons: Cons: Initial data set-up can be a bit of work depending on the industry you are based.
overall: Overall: It's an amazing tool that helps you out with managing funds that are generated from events. Whether fit's ticket sales, fundraisers or donations, you can always rely on the app. In fact, you get to enjoy remote access in case you happen to move around a lot.

title: wait until you die to hear back from customer service....
name: monika L.
comments: Comments: The Townsend Center for the Performing Arts is now in its second season with PatronManager. The system is built on the SalesForce Platform, which is the leading CRM and database platform used by most of the Fortune 500 companies.
pros: Pros: there are some nice features that makes some set ups easy and quick. it's great database. The reporting is endless.
cons:
Cons: I have never seen such a bad customer service in my life. In many situations , I waited 2 months to get a response!!! usually it's weeks. I have complained many times, but the response was that we can pay for faster response time. Insane! This is my major problem with this product.

There are also some limitations due to Salesforce features, like confirmation e-mails that have very complicated HTML coding.
overall: Overall: It's not an intuitive product and require a lot of effort to use it and learn it.

title: Overall Patronmanager is a good product for the price. Great for mid-size organizations
name: Chase M.
comments: Comments: The Townsend Center for the Performing Arts is now in its second season with PatronManager. The system is built on the SalesForce Platform, which is the leading CRM and database platform used by most of the Fortune 500 companies.
pros: Pros: It is web accesible, and once you figure out with tech support how to get it integrated to the look and feel of your own website, it provides a good patron experience.
cons: Cons: Getting the right report is pretty difficult. There are not enough standard reports that are useful for us and we have found that many reports we need require a call to tech support to ask them to make it. Tech support is more responsive on email than on phone.
overall: Overall: It's not an intuitive product and require a lot of effort to use it and learn it.

title: Best in Class CRM Software!
name: Jeremy W.
comments: Comments: The Townsend Center for the Performing Arts is now in its second season with PatronManager. The system is built on the SalesForce Platform, which is the leading CRM and database platform used by most of the Fortune 500 companies.
pros: Pros: Very robust and customize-able! Can configure the system to work with your specific operation and can do most of that yourself.
cons: Cons: Takes too long for help desk to respond to questions/issues. Would like online chat to be able to get instant responses to quick questions.
overall: Overall: It's not an intuitive product and require a lot of effort to use it and learn it.

title: PatronManager is a comprehensive CRM that lacks the ease of use that comparable programs have.
name: Verified Reviewer
comments: Comments: The Townsend Center for the Performing Arts is now in its second season with PatronManager. The system is built on the SalesForce Platform, which is the leading CRM and database platform used by most of the Fortune 500 companies.
pros: Pros: The CRM function is a great tool. The program holds all customer data and is organized by contacts, households, etc. Users can easily search by any aspect of the customer account (name, email, phone, etc). The multiple reporting features are also very useful.
cons: Cons: It is extremely frustrating that there is not an option to automatically connect online orders to an existing account.
